commit_message:
Update get_metadata to return {}

Fixes bug 951093

While the actual issue was encountered in keystone/service.py,
the underlying issue is that all identity backends seems to be
returning None when no metadata is found for a user. I would argue
that returning {} makes it easier on clients.

Change-Id: I06faf755cc0dbe45b5d0a0f86c6235b27c856047

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-03-19 23:33:17.000000000', 'message': "Strip out characters that should be escaped from console output

Minidom has a bug where it doesn't escape characters < 32 correctly.
That is http://bugs.python.org/issue5752

We probably want to move to lxml anyway.

Console-output is particularly likely to have invalid characters,
because ANSI output include the ESC character (0x1B).  Strip out
invalid characters for this case (although the problem is still
present anywhere we write a string in the XML)

Bug #939386

Change-Id: I4689c0f26fb4887867a8d5b6f5e5fb5e2590be91
"}]
commit_message:
Strip out characters that should be escaped from console output

Minidom has a bug where it doesn't escape characters < 32 correctly.
That is http://bugs.python.org/issue5752

We probably want to move to lxml anyway.

Console-output is particularly likely to have invalid characters,
because ANSI output include the ESC character (0x1B).  Strip out
invalid characters for this case (although the problem is still
present anywhere we write a string in the XML)

Bug #939386

Change-Id: I4689c0f26fb4887867a8d5b6f5e5fb5e2590be91

commit_message:
Improve performance of generating dhcp leases

 * Dont make 2 * instances queries when generating dhcp leases
 * Uses some nasty joins to minimize necessary changes
 * Adds test to verify functionality
 * Uses old sqlalchemy compatible join syntax
 * Uses vif_id as nw identifier for single_host_gateway mode
 * Cleans up tests in linux_net
 * Fixes bug 959378

Change-Id: I1c74d114dd7caad1781180585bb65691e536bcf9

commit_message:
Corrects glance image action permissions.

  * Admins have full permissions to edit and delete images
    from syspanel, plus Glance's client returns a proper
    403 error instead of 401, so inappropriate access no longer
    logs the user out inappropriately. Fixes bug 955744.
  * Regular users can edit and delete if their tenant owns the
    image. Fixes bug 950364 and fixes bug 737360.

Note, this requires the latest version of Glance.

Change-Id: Ib816d7e6e1320a9024c5dbe95b04249291ec0463

commit_message:
Don't use auth url to determine service protocol

Change the behavior of the command line glance client so that it no
longer assumes that the glance service always has the same protocol type
as the authentication service. Determine protocol from the given glance
service url. If no url is given, allow users to specify the protocol on
the command line with the --ssl option. If --ssl is not given, default
to using http.

Change-Id: I949c2ac429c67c3d1752a7b6fc840aa9e45fca8c

die lines, die!'}, {'account_id': 209, 'date': '2012-03-19 22:00:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

Is this really unused? test_xenapi.py:test_get_diagnostics seems to use it."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-03-19 22:03:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The file doesnt care about contents, it only cares about having a valid file. I extracted 10000 lines of unused data points while leaving the file parseable. It's ridiculous for 10% of our codebase to be contained in this one file."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-03-19 22:04:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

when I say 'The file doesnt care about contents', I mean the *test* doesn't care."}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-03-19 22:08:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

It looks like the test does care about the contents of that file. If I replace it with an empty file it fails.

I guess what you're trying to say is that the test doesn't care about the extra data you're trying to remove."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-03-19 22:10:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

subject: Shut down cleanly upon SIGHUP.
messages:
[{'account_id': 209, 'date': '2012-03-19 21:30:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not submit

'}, {'account_id': 209, 'date': '2012-03-19 21:33:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Got ahead of myself.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-03-19 21:33:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I don't understand this.  Generally daemon processes use SIGHUP to signal a restart, not to shutdown.

Handling SIGTERM this way would make sense.  Also if you want to exit cleanly you can always manually send SIGINT to signal a keyboard interrupt:
kill -2 <pid>"}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-03-19 22:03:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm with Vish here; HUP == reload/restart in my mind, while TERM == shutdown…"}, {'account_id': 209, 'date': '2012-03-19 22:21:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yep, I actually took that from Glance after a quick... glance. :)

I'm updating to use SIGTERM instead."}]

[{'created': '2012-03-19 21:19:16.000000000', 'message': 'Shut down cleanly upon SIGHUP.

Change-Id: I9070d95bbf17aebdc396ca69c028c593db5c809d
'}]

commit_message:
Allow message assertions to check response context as well.

This makes it a little more flexible in edge cases where
the messages have already been unset in the cookie storage
(e.g. the request-response cycle is complete).

Change-Id: I9f3b1ec3f908d05c523ce013ab5fbd73837aff55

Adds service name to services table.

Also moves most of the logic to a Service wrapper class to make it
reusable. Adds tests for the new service class as well as the
syspanel services view.

Fixes bug 956552.

commit_message:
Added AJAX updating error handling.

  * Splits the AJAX complete method into complete, success, and error.
  * Cleans up 404 (e.g. gone/deleted) handling.
  * Adds 5XX error handling.
  * Adds client-side alert message templating.
  * Adds client-side conf (debug and static_url) loaded from backend.

Fixes bug 957461.

Change-Id: I5114430d35e2d20603e817651540b2db1f8a4d07

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-03-14 17:57:40.000000000', 'message': 'Added optional max_containers_per_account restr...

Added optional max_containers_per_account restriction. If set to a
positive value and if a client tries to perform a container PUT when
at or above the max_containers_per_acount cap, a 403 Forbidden will
be returned with an explanatory message.

This only restricts the proxy server, not any of the background
processes that might need to create containers (replication, for
instance). Also, the container count is cached for the proxy's
recheck_account_existence number of seconds. For these reasons, a
given account could exceed this cap before the 403 Forbidden
responses kick in and therefore this feature should be considered a
"soft" limit.

You may also add accounts to the proxy's max_containers_whitelist
setting to have accounts that ignore this cap.

Change-Id: I74e8fb152de5e78d070ed30006ad4e53f82c8376
'}, {'created': '2012-03-15 19:41:32.000000000', 'message': 'Added optional max_containers_per_account restr...

Added optional max_containers_per_account restriction. If set to a
positive value and if a client tries to perform a container PUT when
at or above the max_containers_per_acount cap, a 403 Forbidden will
be returned with an explanatory message.

This only restricts the proxy server, not any of the background
processes that might need to create containers (replication, for
instance). Also, the container count is cached for the proxy's
recheck_account_existence number of seconds. For these reasons, a
given account could exceed this cap before the 403 Forbidden
responses kick in and therefore this feature should be considered a
"soft" limit.

You may also add accounts to the proxy's max_containers_whitelist
setting to have accounts that ignore this cap.

Change-Id: I74e8fb152de5e78d070ed30006ad4e53f82c8376
'}]
commit_message:
Added optional max_containers_per_account restr...

Added optional max_containers_per_account restriction. If set to a
positive value and if a client tries to perform a container PUT when
at or above the max_containers_per_acount cap, a 403 Forbidden will
be returned with an explanatory message.

This only restricts the proxy server, not any of the background
processes that might need to create containers (replication, for
instance). Also, the container count is cached for the proxy's
recheck_account_existence number of seconds. For these reasons, a
given account could exceed this cap before the 403 Forbidden
responses kick in and therefore this feature should be considered a
"soft" limit.

You may also add accounts to the proxy's max_containers_whitelist
setting to have accounts that ignore this cap.

Change-Id: I74e8fb152de5e78d070ed30006ad4e53f82c8376

subject: Adds a tempest run script...
messages:
[{'account_id': 1, 'date': '2012-03-19 17:07:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Thanks for working on this!

I think there is at least one problem, and one thing that could
be simpler.  The problem is that it looks like you've renamed
devstack-vm-gate-host.sh (the portion of the gate script that
runs on the host) to devstack-vm-prep-host.sh, but
devstack-vm-gate.sh (the main gate script) still invokes both of
those.  I can't quite tell what the intent was, but it won't work
since only -prep-host exists in this change.  I don't think this
bit of the change is necessary.

I don't think devstack-vm-tempest-host is necessary.  It repeats
most of the code that's in devstack-vm-gate.sh.  Instead, we can
just (1) add tempest to the PROJECTS list in devstack-vm-gate.sh.
That will cause it to be copied over to the host along with the
rest of the workspace.  Then just (2) add the unique bits from the
end of that script:

  # Create the tempest configuration file
  CONFIG_INI=etc/tempest.conf
  /opt/stack/devstack/tools/configure_tempest.sh

  nosetests -v tempest

to devstack-vm-gate-host.sh.  I think items (1) and (2) are the
only things we need to do to.  Also, adding it to
devstack-vm-update-image.py would be nice so it's pre-cached on
the image for speed."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-19 17:07:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-devstack-gate-merge/16/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-03-19 17:07:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Starting fresh after comments from Jim...'}]

commit_message:
Removes flag designation and --

In essex, flags are no more. They are configuration options.
This merge attempts to clean that up.
Also needed to assign xml:id to some sections in the Qpid write up - that ensures comments stay with the page they were intended for even if we rearrange
the content a bit.

Change-Id: I7d76b11347ca4b369646da74b36c6f79b3671a13

commit_message:
Drafting updates to install/deploy

Fixed pom file to create a -trunk pdf.
Updated Dashboard image.
Added keystone.conf file after testing with a VM
Added more to glance validation steps
Still needs testing but might be close enough?
Also want to get Xen in there but we can publish before that.
Updated Keystone config based on reviews and Mailing List input.
Removed "identity management" chapter as it was overkill for this context.
Changed the ADMIN fake token to 012345SECRET99TOKEN012345.
Update to include Glance configuration files.
Updated to use an essex-style nova.conf file.
Please review with "draft" in mind and give feedback.

Change-Id: Ic7e50eddf7130bbbbce28f2646e2eb1d85583294

commit_message:
Add check for MAX_PASSWORD_LENGTH to utils.

Updates to keystone password hashing and checking functions so
that a max password length is enforced.

Fixes LP Bug #959288.

Change-Id: Id3048f3c916e92c59ac5b063d09c3d612d51c97c

commit_message:
Fixes LP #957401 - Remove stray output on stderr

* Removes a stray print statement that was in the
  API functional test
* Does a NOOP log_message method to the request
  handler used in glance.tests.functional.store_utils
  to prevent output in test runs frmo the HTTP server

Change-Id: I663593d9d666d35d3c2c1655598ef68304726fd4

messages:

Chmouel, admin_token is deprecated but still supported in the Keystone middleware. We are removing it from the Glance paste ini files here in preparation for complete removal.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-03-19 15:17:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

Jay: responded inline. 

Chmouel: we do still support using a single admin token, but the middleware will try to get a new admin token with the provided admin user/pass/tenant if no token is provided. This is the preferred flow, so I decided to cut the cord now.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-03-19 15:18:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Update glance pipelines to use context middleware

* Glance no longer depends on keystone.middleware.glance_auth_token

commit_message:
Avoid tests leaking empty tmp dirs.

Stop the leakage of empty temporary dirs from TestConfigOpts,
which is regularly causing the Jenkins build to fail.

Change-Id: I0aee6bf55f49adbef948bc56d045639a75455e1a

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-03-09 20:19:57.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes Bug #950364 - Tenant Name not ID used

* Updates the glance_auth_token middleware to grab the
  value of X_TENANT_ID instead of X_TENANT header.
* Does the same for user and updates to use X_ROLES instead
  of X_ROLE header

Change-Id: Ib54c250849155aa0226a96eff9bdfdfb43e5da8f
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes Bug #950364 - Tenant Name not ID used

* Updates the glance_auth_token middleware to grab the
  value of X_TENANT_ID instead of X_TENANT header.
* Does the same for user and updates to use X_ROLES instead
  of X_ROLE header

Change-Id: Ib54c250849155aa0226a96eff9bdfdfb43e5da8f

commit_message:
Do not error when service does not have 'type'.

Although 'type' should be present, it would seem a NoServiceEndpoint
exception would be more appropriate in the case of a misconfigured
authentication service.

Fixes bug 956178

(Patch Set 2) Updated to add logging

Change-Id: Ic8f552d8921107664cdd472f8476a9bd04322131

commit_message:
Remove exception content from error message
in case of unknown(non app exception) in keystoneclient.
This handles the case with http 500 exceptions which
might pass some stack trace or other sensitive information.

Fixes bug 956754

Change-Id: Ic6703d179d8c6a4243c716c27c7017b311559d9b

commit_message:
Security Group Rule enhancements.

  * Corrects inconcsistent capitalization. Fixes bug 956760.
  * Adds a default value for CIDR and updates handling code. Fixes bug 956771.
  * Corrects the way SelfHandlingForm access the cleaned data. Fixes bug 958971.

Change-Id: I66afeb4b530be350f33f63c8f9a60bd4a20e01bf

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-03-19 04:37:35.000000000', 'message': 'Paring down the syspanel instances table.

There was simply too much information in that table to be usable.
It probably still needs to lose more weight in favor of moving things
to a more admin-oriented detail page. However, we need to get real user
feedback on what data is critical for the overview vs. what can be in
a detail page.

Fixes bug 944506.

Change-Id: Iaad218bc6ed6647645c5943920467bec097a0a2d
'}]
commit_message:
Paring down the syspanel instances table.

There was simply too much information in that table to be usable.
It probably still needs to lose more weight in favor of moving things
to a more admin-oriented detail page. However, we need to get real user
feedback on what data is critical for the overview vs. what can be in
a detail page.

Fixes bug 944506.

Change-Id: Iaad218bc6ed6647645c5943920467bec097a0a2d

[{'created': '2012-03-19 03:41:27.000000000', 'message': 'Stub-implement floating-ip functions on FlatManager

This was messing up horizon in a way that would probably be difficult to fix.
It also is probably a bit tricky to implement floating ips properly for
FlatManager at this stage of the release cycle.  Stub them out for now,
to keep horizon happy.

Bug #954580
Bug #937227

Change-Id: Icb8d689860b893ebeeee02e248e836c52830b2de
'}]
commit_message:
Stub-implement floating-ip functions on FlatManager

This was messing up horizon in a way that would probably be difficult to fix.
It also is probably a bit tricky to implement floating ips properly for
FlatManager at this stage of the release cycle.  Stub them out for now,
to keep horizon happy.

Bug #954580
Bug #937227

Change-Id: Icb8d689860b893ebeeee02e248e836c52830b2de

commit_message:
allow the compute service to start with missing libvirt disks

* nova/virt/libvirt/connection.py: Program defensively and handle
the case of missing instance disks and log the error rather than
propagating that exception up (which triggers nova.service to fail).
* Fixes bug 957110

Change-Id: I1a414f56661843ff6b886e6ebf6f614fcb5a5f31

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-03-18 22:32:07.000000000', 'message': 'Instantiate novaclient managers for test data.

Some novaclient resources now have a "human_id" property
which requires a call to a bound method on the manager. Thereby
we need to instantiate the managers in the test data rather than
simply passing the class.

Fixes bug 958857.

Change-Id: I1331e4ae5658b45d01b8247623554c5c43f67578
'}, {'created': '2012-03-18 22:43:55.000000000', 'message': 'Instantiate novaclient managers for test data.

Some novaclient resources now have a "human_id" property
which requires a call to a bound method on the manager. Thereby
we need to instantiate the managers in the test data rather than
simply passing the class.

Fixes bug 958857.

There's also some cleanup on the test settings here, to remove
some outdated settings and to use an in-memory database instead
of a file on disk.

Change-Id: I1331e4ae5658b45d01b8247623554c5c43f67578
'}]
commit_message:
Instantiate novaclient managers for test data.

Some novaclient resources now have a "human_id" property
which requires a call to a bound method on the manager. Thereby
we need to instantiate the managers in the test data rather than
simply passing the class.

Fixes bug 958857.

There's also some cleanup on the test settings here, to remove
some outdated settings and to use an in-memory database instead
of a file on disk.

Change-Id: I1331e4ae5658b45d01b8247623554c5c43f67578

commit_message:
nose plugin to capture glance service logs

Adding custom nose plugin to capture entire glance service logs
for failed tests.

Disabled by default, enable by setting:

  $ NOSE_GLANCELOGCAPTURE=true ; ./run_tests.sh

Change-Id: I8a3bd9529ec6adb8b98804e0ddc266a7ea8eca08

commit_message:
Remove default quantum-keystoneclient dep.

 * Don't automatically install q-cli with horizon
 * Always install q-cli if ENABLED_SERVICES includes 'quantum'
 * Completely remove quantum config from horizon (there is no quantum+horizon in essex)

Change-Id: I0897437326abd757b6c792fd6ec946fa6e7981c9

commit_message:
nonblocking libvirt mode using tpool

Add an option libvirt_nonblocking (disabled by default) to use a thread
pool to execute all libvirt API calls. Previously all the calls except
one in firewall.py are blocking in the eventlet thread model.

Change-Id: I665ed7a629bb029011b181e8d2844fc2276502d9

commit_message:
Fix run/terminate race conditions.

 * synchronize run,terminate,stop,start on instance_uuid
 * don't surpress error when unfiltering instance, which
   can result in a zombified instance.
 * Fixes bug 956719
 * Remove debug raise

Change-Id: I8b2eaffdabfd5c1a9414adb1b5ed11e4c48711fc

commit_message:
Workaround issue with greenthreads and lockfiles

 * Adds a GreenLockFile that always works in greenthreads
 * Adds test to verify that regular Lockfile is broken
 * Adds test to verify that GreenLockfile works
 * Adds note about limitation of external locks
 * Adds test showing limitation of nested locks
 * Fixes bug 956313

Change-Id: I11cd1206611aa4862dadd2fcc077c4c2e0f798f6

commit_message:
Add admin_role option

* Allow a deployer to define the role that should give an authenticated
  user admin privileges. Defaults to 'admin'
* Fixes bug 956547

Change-Id: I018b9c438a12c527833ed8e2e6c377a93fde9130

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-03-15 21:13:58.000000000', 'message': 'Add new UnexpectedStatus exception.

Raise UnexpectedStatus as opposed to a generic Exception when

commit_message:
Add new UnexpectedStatus exception.

Raise UnexpectedStatus as opposed to a generic Exception when
an unexpected HTTP status is seen by the glance client.

Further fix for bug 952618

Change-Id: I222c7553e1a687aec0f6dde8215e4400ea6be2cb

It seems that skip on a class does not prevent the setup code from running. It just skips the test methods.

[{'created': '2012-03-16 14:27:04.000000000', 'message': 'Fix swift restart error

Change-Id: Ib8e30221e1c8873d0e849add89dc87d5ccda9d82
'}, {'created': '2012-03-16 14:28:01.000000000', 'message': "Fix swift restart error

'swift-init all restart' exits with '1' if swift was not already
running, as does 'swift-init all stop'.  Work around this until
swift-init is fixed.

Change-Id: Ib8e30221e1c8873d0e849add89dc87d5ccda9d82
"}, {'created': '2012-03-16 15:53:41.000000000', 'message': "Fix swift restart error

'swift-init all {restart|stop}' exits with '1' if there are any problems
sutting down any swift server, including if they were not running to begin with.
An attempt to address this has already been ignored by the Swift team, and it
would not have completely eliminated the problem, so we'll just be defensive here.

Change-Id: Ib8e30221e1c8873d0e849add89dc87d5ccda9d82
"}]
commit_message:
Fix swift restart error

'swift-init all {restart|stop}' exits with '1' if there are any problems
sutting down any swift server, including if they were not running to begin with.
An attempt to address this has already been ignored by the Swift team, and it
would not have completely eliminated the problem, so we'll just be defensive here.

Change-Id: Ib8e30221e1c8873d0e849add89dc87d5ccda9d82

commit_message:
Destroy rescue instance if main instance is destroyed

Fixes bug 955166

If the main instance was destroyed while an instance was in rescue mode
the rescue instance would not be destroyed. Ensure it gets destroyed
too.

Change-Id: I7d411a2b532fae7ba90c0639527805f47913fce6

Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien.danjou@enovance.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix tenant retrieval from token for creds

A token may not have a tenant, so user_token_ref['tenant'] may be None,
therefore the above code failed.
We fix it by checking that the token has a tenant declared.

Change-Id: I25f4a83161012177f5e72435038dec45b85ad7ed
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien.danjou@enovance.com>

commit_message:
Remove glance-cache-queue-image

* bin/glance-cache-queue-image duplicates functionality provided by
  bin/ glance-cache-manage, and it is currently broken. Let's just remove it.

Change-Id: Ib18be2116055154047df6ca9b4c335323c8b2dde

subject: First tentative of docbook tidy (tidy -xml -i filename.xml)
messages:
[{'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-03-02 18:15:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

First of all, congratulations on creating a diff that Gerrit can't display! ;)

tidy defaults to 68 columns, which looks narrow to me. I think we should do something in 78-80 range. PEP8 uses 79, so I'd recommend going with that.

I also think we should trim all trailing whitespace, which tidy apparently doesn't do. That means we'll have to run a separate filter after tidy for doing that. 

I suggest something like this:

tidy -xml -wrap 79 -i filename.xml | sed 's/[ \t]*$//'"}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-03-05 18:52:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Wow, yeah congrats. :) So why use tidy if Oxygen is the known commonality, can we let Oxygen do the pretty printing or is that going to be worse? How did Russel do his pretty-print?'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-03-05 19:27:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Aaanndd. I'll answer my own question. Russel used XMLMind. I'm not sure yet how that will be handled by Oxygen in subsequent reviews, are we making the problem worse? Doing some homework."}, {'account_id': 1441, 'date': '2012-03-05 19:55:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Recent versions of Oxygen by default only touch lines that are edited. So if your file is wrapped in some way other than Oxygen does, it will not touch any lines except those where you make edits. We have it configured to pretty print at 70 chars.'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-03-05 20:23:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Tidy should be fine, use 70 for line length.'}, {'account_id': 1627, 'date': '2012-03-05 22:26:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-03-06 14:12:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-03-10 00:59:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-10 01:00:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Fails

Build Failed 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-manuals-merge/162/ : FAILURE'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-03-10 01:06:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score; No score

Looks like this needs to be re-tidied against changes in the master branch.'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-03-10 01:17:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Yeah, sorry for all the churn but we've gotta get content updates above and beyond format updates. :)"}, {'account_id': 1627, 'date': '2012-03-16 00:01:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-03-16 01:16:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-03-16 11:27:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

Build Successful

[{'created': '2012-03-16 11:07:40.000000000', 'message': "plugin/ryu/agent: unbreak a06b316cb47369ef4a2c522f5240fa3f7f529135

ryu quantum agent needs 'import shlex' like ovs and linuxbridge.
Otherwise it aborts as

> NameError: global name 'shlex' is not defined

Change-Id: I0d0e4a95a4628953bf44bebf54c46f74aa9eddf4
Signed-off-by: Isaku Yamahata <yamahata@valinux.co.jp>
"}]
commit_message:
plugin/ryu/agent: unbreak a06b316cb47369ef4a2c522f5240fa3f7f529135

ryu quantum agent needs 'import shlex' like ovs and linuxbridge.
Otherwise it aborts as

> NameError: global name 'shlex' is not defined

Change-Id: I0d0e4a95a4628953bf44bebf54c46f74aa9eddf4
Signed-off-by: Isaku Yamahata <yamahata@valinux.co.jp>

[{'created': '2012-03-15 00:40:53.000000000', 'message': 'Remove Virtual Storage Array (VSA) code

* Remove core vsa code (api, manager, drivers)
* Remove nova-vsa executable
* Remove OpenStack Compute API v2 vsa extension
* Remove vsa scheduler
* Remove vsa db api methods

commit_message:
Remove Virtual Storage Array (VSA) code

* Remove core vsa code (api, manager, drivers)
* Remove nova-vsa executable
* Remove OpenStack Compute API v2 vsa extension
* Remove vsa scheduler
* Remove vsa db api methods
* Remove Zadara volume driver
* Do not migrate out any existing data
* Fixes bug 954490

Change-Id: Idab3d60796d5edbc23ef9f0887fcc1af558c6215

commit_message:
Bug #956559
VIF driver and scheduler for UCS plugin are broken since the flag
configuration mechanism in nova is changed. Fixing that and also
fixing some property names, along changes to how the quantum client
code is invoked.

Change-Id: I757cc149f08673ce24d35ee0bfffae8e5b1a4afc

subject: Adds support to select Quantum networks within Launch Instance flow
messages:
[{'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2012-02-22 20:20:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not submit

(3 inline comments)

This review has Python syntax errors in it, raises uncaught exceptions if quantum isn't enabled, and errors out of the entire test suite. I'm all for getting better integration happening with quantum, but with quantum as an approved-to-be-core project we need to get reviews that have been tested more thoroughly than this. Especially to be reaching outside of the "networks" panel.

As a comment on the whole review, there needs to be checking for whether or not quantum is enabled to control whether or not any of the quantum-related code in the launch instance view is executed and whether or not it is displayed to the end user. This probably belongs in both the view, and in the form's init method to hide the field.'}, {'account_id': 1803, 'date': '2012-02-23 06:10:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2012-02-23 20:11:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (6 inline comments)

There are plenty of notes inline, but I have one additional comment:

Despite the additional complexity incurred by adding a test for this, I strongly feel the unit tests need to cover both quantum enabled and quantum not enabled. There are too many ways it can go wrong right now, and I absolutely won't let a patchset in that breaks launching an instance for the majority of users. I want to be absolutely sure that doesn't happen.

Testing that will require manipulating the service catalog on the test user for the existing tests (essentially leaving them as they are) and then adding a brand new (largely duplicate) test for the quantum-enabled state."}, {'account_id': 1803, 'date': '2012-02-29 13:07:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 357, 'date': '2012-03-01 18:17:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Do not submit

After speaking with danwent, we decided the best thing to do would be to revisit this in the first Folsom milestone.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-03-16 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-03-16 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity'}]

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7, 'name': 'Jay Pipes', 'email': 'jaypipes@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaypipes'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 537, 'name': 'a abes', 'username': 'a-abes'}, {'_account_id': 1297, 'name': 'Joshua Harlow', 'email': 'jxharlow@godaddy.com', 'username': 'harlowja'}, {'_account_id': 1580, 'name': 'Nachi Ueno', 'username': 'nati-ueno-s', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 2035, 'name': 'Maru Newby', 'email': 'marun@redhat.com', 'username': 'maru'}]

[{'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-02-08 03:38:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

(1 inline comment)

Looks pretty good to me, but would be best to have a Swift expert look this over...'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-02-08 04:35:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-02-08 04:36:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Nah, no worries... when I read through the SAIO docs, I realized why you hard-coded Lucid :)

We can work on templatizing the recipe after the alignment currently being discussed on the ML starts happening..

Best,

-jay'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-02-15 01:47:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-02-15 01:51:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Patch 2 adds installation of openstack.nose_plugin to ensure that .unittests will still run as advertised once the tox changes land in swift.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-02-15 01:52:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Ah, nice update.'}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2012-02-28 21:25:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

Just want to make sure scripts that are made work on more than 1 distro since openstack needs to get out of the 1 distro mode...'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-02-28 21:28:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

harlowja:  As mentioned in the commit message, this script automates the documented procedure for creating a Swift AIO.  Since the documentation prescribes Ubuntu 10.04 - and relies upon a Launchpad PPA for many of its dependencies - so does this recipe.'}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2012-02-28 21:30:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Ok, so the desire is to keep with the status quo? Is it possible to make this chef cookbook not have that limitation (without that much work)? Wouldn't that be preferable?"}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-02-28 21:32:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hi Josh, I'm of the mind that such (wanted) improvements can come in a separate patch, no?

I think Maru was sticking to the letter of the developer SAIO docs, which is why this cookbook looks the way it does.

Would certainly love to see a patch from ya for a more agnostic setup."}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2012-02-28 21:38:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

;) Good call.'}, {'account_id': 537, 'date': '2012-02-28 22:25:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(4 inline comments)

My overall impression is that this code would be much easier to maintain in pure bash scripts, ala devStack, rather than chef... Chef seems to just get in the way here, without actually adding much  value for the developer use cases that this cookbook addresses.

Seems that what you're trying to address could be achieved with a few scripts:
* prep_system - setup the basic pre-reqs (rsyslog, rsync,python, pip etc)
* deploy_code - which could take a git repo or use a PPA
* run - which just does all the things require to run stuff.
* reset - which resets things.

From a developer perspective, you'd want to run these at different times, based on what you're trying to do. With chef, you'd have to go tweak the node to adjust it's run_list just so it would run the script you want to run...


That said, I've included a few inline comments.."}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-02-28 22:57:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Should this change be abandoned?  I'm getting the sense that nobody actually wants it."}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2012-02-28 23:26:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I think its still useful. Its a good reference/example imho.'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-03-01 01:25:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (4 inline comments)

a abes:  I have some questions about your comments in advance of submitting a revised patch.  Please reply at your convenience.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-03-08 06:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-03-08 06:03:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-03-08 06:07:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

So should I resubmit this?  Or leave it be?

And who do I talk to about getting a warning before automatic abandonment?'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-03-08 20:05:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Maru, you can chat with mtaylor and jeblair about the automated abandon stuff on IRC...

I would actually like to see this go in somewhere, but I'm not sure *where* based on feedback on this patchset...

Perhaps we should start a thread on the ML to see what the community thinks about these options:

 * Create a new cookbook for SAIO (as opposed to production Swift cookbook)
 * Create a new recipe for SAIO under a generic Swift cookbook
 * Some other strategy

Thoughts?

-jay"}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-03-09 02:40:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Jay:  I thought naming the cookbook 'swift-aio' would make things clear, but are you thinking that changing the name to SAIO would help?  I'd be happy to ask on the mailing list if you do."}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-03-09 02:51:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Restored

Still working on this...'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-03-16 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-03-16 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review'}]

commit_message:
Add cookbook for Swift All In One.

* Added a new recipe, swift-aio, that implements the OpenStack instructions
  for creating a Swift All In One:

  http://swift.openstack.org/development_saio.html

  Where possible the recipes in the cookbook follow the logical flow of
  the instructions and the resulting environment should be exactly the
  same as if the instructions where executed manually.

* Updated the apt::default recipe to reflect the latest from
  opscode, and added a resource that allows forcing of an apt-get update
  once the swift-core ppa repo has been configured on the system.

Change-Id: I9f0c3006aae6c20cda0ac1eae375ea836f3ee4bd

commit_message:
db api: Remove check for security groups reference

security_group_in_use() should only be checking that a security
group is associated with running instances, not that other groups
are referencing it in their rules.  With this check in place, it
becomes impossible to delete self-referential security groups.

Fixes bug 956366.

Update: Remove obsolete test as well

Change-Id: I31f49c655b044dbaf0fb66dfaadb876c9dc3d167

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-03-16 01:11:28.000000000', 'message': "Allow proper instance cleanup if state == SHUTOFF

Removes an obsolete check for instance's power_state
on shutdown_instance().  With it in place, volume detachment
and disassociation never takes place.  Compute should instead rely
on virt drivers to handle this case and raise accordingly. libvirt's
destroy() currently handles powered off instances fine, and properly
detaches any existing volume connections.

Fixes bug 954692

Change-Id: I200d5b2073e5b52a9733d8324d016b14bdc96067
"}, {'created': '2012-03-16 02:39:10.000000000', 'message': "Allow proper instance cleanup if state == SHUTOFF

Removes an obsolete check for instance's power_state
on shutdown_instance().  With it in place, volume detachment
and disassociation never takes place.  Compute should instead rely
on virt drivers to handle this case and raise accordingly. libvirt's
destroy() currently handles powered off instances fine, and properly
detaches any existing volume connections.

Fixes bug 954692

Change-Id: I200d5b2073e5b52a9733d8324d016b14bdc96067
"}]
commit_message:
Allow proper instance cleanup if state == SHUTOFF

Removes an obsolete check for instance's power_state
on shutdown_instance().  With it in place, volume detachment
and disassociation never takes place.  Compute should instead rely
on virt drivers to handle this case and raise accordingly. libvirt's
destroy() currently handles powered off instances fine, and properly
detaches any existing volume connections.

Fixes bug 954692

Change-Id: I200d5b2073e5b52a9733d8324d016b14bdc96067

[{'created': '2012-03-16 00:26:53.000000000', 'message': 'Remove reference to distributed data store.

The compute admin guide incorrectly states that nova uses a distributed
datastore to maintain system state. I think at one point, nova used Redis,
but it currently uses a traditional database such as MySQL or PostgreSQL.

Fixes bug #912091

Change-Id: I9d6cf491b0d95ad8a88e56795fdda4fc18e26b0c
'}]
commit_message:
Remove reference to distributed data store.

The compute admin guide incorrectly states that nova uses a distributed
datastore to maintain system state. I think at one point, nova used Redis,
but it currently uses a traditional database such as MySQL or PostgreSQL.

Fixes bug #912091

Change-Id: I9d6cf491b0d95ad8a88e56795fdda4fc18e26b0c

commit_message:
ryu/nova: catch up d1888a3359345acffd8d0845c137eefd88072112

FLAGS.add_option -> FLAGS.register_opt

> commit d1888a3359345acffd8d0845c137eefd88072112
> Author: Mark McLoughlin <markmc@redhat.com>
> Date:   Fri Feb 3 00:50:58 2012 +0000
>
>     Remove the last of the gflags shim layer
>
>     Make FLAGS a ConfigOpts instance and fix up all the places where we
>     expected FlagValues behaviour.
>
>     Change-Id: I8f96f42e0d8d30ba6b362d29861e717cf0fa9e89

and removed work around for circular import as the nova change set of
1265104b873d4cd791cecc62134ef874b4656003 fixes the circular import issue.

Change-Id: I4897dc848efa7fff6c73399a72d876fb503121e7

commit_message:
Add retry support to the quantum client.

 * Based on the retry support in nova's melange_connection
   and glance
 * Retry configuration is defined during Client instantiation and
   only applied to idempotent GET requests
 * Updated all api methods to call http method helpers (delete/get/post/put)
   rather than do_request to ensure consistent behavoir for a given http
   method.
 * Fixed bug in quantum.common.exceptions.QuantumClientException that
   was unnecessarily overriding class's 'message' attribute.
 * Resolves bug 937379

Change-Id: Iab4e2ccf97937502ee0df58dba1e2dca30a36df8

fix timestamps to match documented ec2 api

fixes bug: 823503

Update to the dateTime format to provide three places of precision to
microseconds.  This change makes the API match the ec2 documents.

accordingly. NotImplementedError()'s are caught and returned as proper

commit_message:
Properly return 501 for unsupported Catalog calls

Similar to the other APIs, this creates a Driver class that describes
expected functionality of the catalog driver and raises NotImplemented
accordingly. NotImplementedError()'s are caught and returned as proper
501s instead of AttributeErrors.

Also fixes some inconsistent paramters names in the sql backend.

Fixes bug 954087

Update: Convert usage of NotImplementedError() to new
        keystone.exception.NotImplemented() for all
        unimplemented driver actions.

Change-Id: I69d8e21a6f651e69b724ec5ed5784645bad80c00

commit_message:
Converts bundle exercise to use swift/s3

- Fix keystone s3token configuration (in admin api not public api).
- Set s3 service in keystone to swift if installed.
- Fixes a bug in bundle.sh
- Adds config options for nova to use swift as s3 store

Change-Id: Ic2fca5aba06a25c0b3a74f1e97d062390a8e2ab1

commit_message:
Remove dependency on apiv1app from cachemanage

* Cache management middleware shouldn't depend on being deployed around
  the glance api v1 app. This breaks that dependency in favor of an
  isolated mapper in the cache management middleware.
* Fixes bug 954596

Change-Id: I3f4f56eac285163d1ce9c7dc1cef5178b16eefb6

commit_message:
Work on consolidating to Compute admin guide only

Removes identity admin manual and image admin manual as separate "books"
Changes index.html to go to "current" which is "trunk" and Diablo only if clicked
Changes compute admin manual to include identity information imported from keystone.openstack.org
Yes, still needs lots of work, just a starting point for consolidation.

status returned to client.

commit_message:
Update swift.common.client with bin/swift changes.

- Add auth version 2 to swift.common.client.
- Remove ununsed imports.
- Fix bug where auth_version should be a string.
- Add test for auth version 2.
- Allow to override the returns of http_connection for tests.
- Sync the passing of headers in bin/swift as well from client.
- Fixes bug 885011
- Previously it was review 3680 but abandoned.
- Address: Maru newby review.
- TODO: properly test auth_v1.

Change-Id: I579d8154828e892596fae9ab75f69d353f15e12c

commit_message:
Updates Image Details page to match other details pages. Fixes bug 955625.

While updating these, a bug was discovered in the tab exception handling
which is also fixed by this patch. Fixes bug 955642.

Also incorporates some cleanup on the other details pages so that
they are all uniform and at their best.

Additionally, added a command to run_tests.sh to update all the translation
strings (./run_tests.sh -m or --makemessages).

Updates translation files.

Change-Id: I61287b91fb442f7343c2ddebfcc547dc559efbdf

commit_message:
Ensure copy and original image IDs differ.

Ensure the copy_from tests have unmarshalled a distinct ID for the
copied image, in order to eliminate the possibility that the subsequent
deletion of the original image impacts on the existence of the copy.

Eliminates one bizarre and unlikely explanation for the test failures
reported in bug 955527.

Change-Id: If8d0720f6d08cdc57a3e01431bd3460d95a868a9

commit_message:
Add error checking to get_terminal_size.

Adds returncode error checking to get_terminal_size so that
it doesn't spew errors to console when running glance commands
in a shell without a TTY.

Fixes LP Bug #956202.

Change-Id: I42e155d168da1f4f25c0dea9ad9768686bd654ce

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-03-10 20:10:42.000000000', 'message': 'Alternate meta header removal method.

Prior to this patch, you removed header metadata (such as
x-account-meta-name or x-container-meta-name) by sending the header
with no value. However, many tools such as curl will not send headers
with empty values.

This patch adds an alternate method for header metadata removal: Send
an x-remove-account-meta-name (x-remove-container-meta-name) header
with any value and the proxy will translate it to the original header
name with no value, indicating removal.

For safety, if you specify both x-remove-account-meta-name and
x-account-meta-name headers in the same request, the -remove header
will be ignored.

Change-Id: Ic220bec05a0e266db85fc8fa50011146ee886d9c
'}, {'created': '2012-03-15 04:42:22.000000000', 'message': 'Alternate meta header removal method.

Prior to this patch, you removed header metadata (such as
x-account-meta-name or x-container-meta-name) by sending the header
with no value. However, many tools such as curl will not send headers
with empty values.

This patch adds an alternate method for header metadata removal: Send
an x-remove-account-meta-name (x-remove-container-meta-name) header
with any value and the proxy will translate it to the original header
name with no value, indicating removal.

For safety, if you specify both x-remove-account-meta-name and
x-account-meta-name headers in the same request, the -remove header
will be ignored.

Change-Id: Ic220bec05a0e266db85fc8fa50011146ee886d9c
'}]
commit_message:
Alternate meta header removal method.

Prior to this patch, you removed header metadata (such as
x-account-meta-name or x-container-meta-name) by sending the header
with no value. However, many tools such as curl will not send headers
with empty values.

This patch adds an alternate method for header metadata removal: Send
an x-remove-account-meta-name (x-remove-container-meta-name) header
with any value and the proxy will translate it to the original header
name with no value, indicating removal.

For safety, if you specify both x-remove-account-meta-name and
x-account-meta-name headers in the same request, the -remove header
will be ignored.

Change-Id: Ic220bec05a0e266db85fc8fa50011146ee886d9c

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-03-15 10:05:39.000000000', 'message': 'Fix LXC volume attach issue

Fix erroneous use of echo to set permissions on LXC volume access.
Fixes bug 943304.

Note that based on input from the duplicate bug (948193), we set:
b x:x rwm
to /sys/fs/cgroup/devices/libvirt/lxc/x/devices.allow

instead of:
c x:x rwm
to /sys/fs/cgroup/devices/sysdefault/libvirt/lxc/x/devices.allow

Change-Id: Ia048d3f46799839b4b85c781bb50488e09ba9b5e
'}]
commit_message:
Fix LXC volume attach issue

Fix erroneous use of echo to set permissions on LXC volume access.
Fixes bug 943304.

Note that based on input from the duplicate bug (948193), we set:
b x:x rwm
to /sys/fs/cgroup/devices/libvirt/lxc/x/devices.allow

instead of:
c x:x rwm
to /sys/fs/cgroup/devices/sysdefault/libvirt/lxc/x/devices.allow

Change-Id: Ia048d3f46799839b4b85c781bb50488e09ba9b5e

Also, if we're looking at e-4, there should be a bug associated with this."}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-03-15 17:13:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I don't see any other problems, but this packaging + test code is not something I know a lot about.  I'd want someone else confident about packaging to look before we approve.  

Also, are you looking to get this in for e-4?  After the busted tarball mess of E-3, I'm pretty nervous about making packaging changes so late unless I'm confident someone has tested them (i.e., install on clean system, etc).  Also, two what degree has this code been already used for other openstack projects?"}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-03-15 17:13:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I've looked over this change and it makes sense, though I haven't tested it, and don't have a great background in their area.  Monty has promised that he is online to fix any issues that might pop up with jenkins, so I'm good going for it :)"}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-03-15 17:13:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

seems like just a merge fix since the last approval'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-03-15 17:13:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

(1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-03-15 17:13:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Monty: Is there an overarching blueprint for implementing tox in all openstack and incubated projects, so as to satisfy Dan's requirement of an associated bug?  

Dan: I implemented tox support for swift and it's additive only - it will make testing easier both in jenkins and for developers but not affect any existing infrastructure.  It is a much better solution to consistent testing than the custom run_tests/install_venv/etc scripts that nova introduced."}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-03-15 17:13:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Split out pip requires and aligned tox file.

Align tox.ini file with standards.
Align setup.py with openstack-common standards.

Change-Id: I333bbd66648c865a5c97ec2661359ab849274446

commit_message:
Letting allocated_ip_address filter by address

For Nova to filter instances by ip address we need
a way for melange to return an address without 
being scoped by tenant.

Change-Id: I9a9cddd4b86a562ac6610179776d0cdf41f1c044

messages:
[{'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2012-02-23 20:35:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 73, 'date': '2012-02-23 21:49:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (3 inline comments)

Some minor comments inline.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-03-02 22:46:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(25 inline comments)

Phew, good direction overall on this David (and Eugene!). Comments about style, some suggestions on structuring classes, and some typo corrections inline.

Thanks!

-jay"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-03-10 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-03-10 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2012-03-10 15:06:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Restored

New patch soon.'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2012-03-12 13:50:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2012-03-12 14:01:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2012-03-12 20:20:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-03-14 17:39:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(3 inline comments)

couple little things inline... but nothing major.

FYI, I here is what I get when I ran the test against my devstack Essex machine:

http://paste.openstack.org/show/9374/

Note the ERROR messages from the rest client. Should probably handle that a bit more cleanly, as they are expected I believe."}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2012-03-15 14:13:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I think it is a feature that the log messages are headed by the class name rather than module name and don't know how to keep that with the logger as a global that would be significantly different than what's there now.

The spurious error messages are caused by logging code in the rest_client that currently cannot be controlled. The stress cleanup is waiting for a get_server failure to know that an instance is deleted and so you see these messages. There needs to be a way to better control the logging behavior of rest_client. Having a mode that prints all request/response would be useful for debugging as well.

If you agree with these comments, please let this change go through and I will fix the README trailing spaces in the next checkin."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-03-15 16:37:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

David, agreed. The change is self-contained anyway, so I'm not worried about the remaining little issues..."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-15 16:38:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-tempest-pep8/87/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-tempest-merge/127/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-15 16:38:02.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

subject: Refactor partition gathering.
messages:
[{'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2012-03-07 00:16:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I need to spend some time thinking and testing this change.

I'm a little worried about memory usage, but it's likely fine.

And the worry I have about not marking 0xffff is that replicas that should have been reassigned might silently not be, retaining their previous assignment which might be a now removed device.

Of course, such silent skipping that causes a problem might be easily detected at validation, so I'm probably worrying for nothing. :)"}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2012-03-07 02:33:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Okay, ran some tests and it definitely uses more memory, but it's no big deal either way.

The validate will definitely detect if a partition is assigned to a device that doesn't exist anymore, so that worry's gone.

It runs exactly at the same speed in my limited testing, but that wasn't really a worry anyway."}, {'account_id': 1603, 'date': '2012-03-12 04:49:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-03-06 18:20:45.000000000', 'message': "Refactor partition gathering.

RingBuilder._reassign_parts() is really moving one (partition,
replica) pair at a time. However, the way that _gather_reassign_parts
passes that data in was strange; it would update each replica's entry
in _replica2part2dev to 0xffff, then return a list of affected
partitions. Now it just returns the pairs to move.

This is helpful in the presence of bugs that affect partition
assignment (e.g. #943493), there's no chance of stray 0xffff values
hanging around and corrupting the partition map.

Also, update my email address.

Change-Id: Ifb3aeb4fac750f66e2ddbad88eb5846e72bac20c
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor partition gathering.

RingBuilder._reassign_parts() is really moving one (partition,
replica) pair at a time. However, the way that _gather_reassign_parts
passes that data in was strange; it would update each replica's entry
in _replica2part2dev to 0xffff, then return a list of affected
partitions. Now it just returns the pairs to move.

This is helpful in the presence of bugs that affect partition
assignment (e.g. #943493), there's no chance of stray 0xffff values
hanging around and corrupting the partition map.

Also, update my email address.

Change-Id: Ifb3aeb4fac750f66e2ddbad88eb5846e72bac20c

Refactor how RingBuilder iterates over its devices.

There were a dozen or so different places in RingBuilder that were
iterating over self.devs and filtering out None; now there's just one.

subject: Add root_helper to quantum agents.
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-15 14:47:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-quantum-merge/177/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 452, 'date': '2012-03-15 14:47:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks Bob!

Good work. Most of the OVS changes look good, I just wanted to check on if we have any impact on installation of the agents on compute nodes? Meaning, for Quantum Server node, we will have a quantum user that runs the commands but I believe we need the quantum user on compute node as well, and is there any specific packaging changes that will be required for agents on compute node?

Besides that I am good with all OVS changes but I added Sumit and Isaku to review LinuxBridge and Ryu plugin changes'}, {'account_id': 490, 'date': '2012-03-15 14:47:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Bob, Would we need to make any changes to the README files of each of the agents? For instance, in the Linux Bridge plugin README we indicate that the agent be run as:
sudo python linuxbridge_quantum_agent.py linuxbridge_conf.ini

Would we need to document the root-helper configuration in the agent conf files?'}, {'account_id': 490, 'date': '2012-03-15 14:47:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks Bob for your quick response. As I understand, information about the root-wrap is really required in the packaging context. If the installation is done from the source, and the agent is run manually, and if the user who is running it has sudo privileges, then the defaults will just work (currently the default root-helper is sudo), and nothing needs to be changed. Just want to confirm this understanding.

If this is true, I would still be in favor of updating the README files. I agree that they are not broken, but some brief information on the root-wrap (including link to the wiki) would be helpful.

I ran the tests for the LinuxBridge plugin agent and they seem to work fine. I don't think there is a Ubuntu package available for Linux Bridge plugin, so I am not sure I can test that. I am trying to do some sanity tests by running from the source."}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2012-03-15 14:47:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Sumit,

Good point. But running the agents as root (via sudo or otherwise) still works, so the readmes aren't really broken. Ideally we'd update the linuxbridge, openvswitch, and ryu readme's to no longer mention sudu and explain root_helper. I did add a comment to the .ini files, and there is a wiki page on rootwrap that covers it pretty well, so I believe the information is available if we don't update the READMEs. Should I update the patch? I can do that shortly, but it would be best to get any other needed updates in at the same time.

-Bob"}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2012-03-15 14:47:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Somik,

You are correct that agent on the compute node will also need a user account to use the rootwrap functionality. The packager/distribution can determine what user agents run as - it may be the same as for quantum-server or a different user. In the Fedora packages, the agents run as the same "quantum" user as quantum-server, and our packaging takes care of creating the user if needed and setting up its sudoers file as well as the systemd unit file that specifies this user.

Note that the default in the upstream configuration files is to just use "sudo", not "sudo quantum-rootwrap", so running the agent as root or any other user with sudo privileges will work.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-15 14:47:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-quantum-merge/188/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2012-03-15 14:47:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

The changes to Ryu plugin looks good as it's mostly mechanical. I've not tested it yet though.
I'll give it a test."}, {'account_id': 452, 'date': '2012-03-15 14:47:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

Looks good, already reviewed for ovs changes.'}, {'account_id': 490, 'date': '2012-03-15 14:47:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Thanks Bob, great work!'}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2012-03-15 14:47:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2012-03-15 14:47:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I updated the patch, changing the linuxbridge README file to no longer require running the agent as root, and providing a link to information on configuring rootwrap. There are no other changes in the updated patch.

The openvswitch and ryu READMEs refer to external documentation that should be updated similarly.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-15 14:47:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-quantum-pep8/230/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-quantum-unittests/203/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-quantum-merge/194/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-15 14:47:34.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2012-03-15 14:47:34.000000000', 'message': 'Add root_helper to quantum agents.

When running commands that require root privileges, the linuxbridge,
openvswitch, and ryu agent now prepend the commands with the value of
the root_helper config variable. This is set to "sudo" in the plugins'
.ini files, allowing the agent to run as a non-root user with
appropriate sudo privilidges.

If root_helper is changed to "sudo quantum-rootwrap",
then the command being run will be filtered against lists of each
agent's valid commands in quantum/rootwrap. See
http://wiki.openstack.org/Packager/Rootwrap for details.

Fixes bug 948467.

Change-Id: I549515068a4ce8ae480905ec5eaab6257445d0c3
Signed-off-by: Bob Kukura <rkukura@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add root_helper to quantum agents.

When running commands that require root privileges, the linuxbridge,
openvswitch, and ryu agent now prepend the commands with the value of
the root_helper config variable. This is set to "sudo" in the plugins'
.ini files, allowing the agent to run as a non-root user with
appropriate sudo privilidges.

If root_helper is changed to "sudo quantum-rootwrap",
then the command being run will be filtered against lists of each
agent's valid commands in quantum/rootwrap. See
http://wiki.openstack.org/Packager/Rootwrap for details.

Fixes bug 948467.

Change-Id: I549515068a4ce8ae480905ec5eaab6257445d0c3
Signed-off-by: Bob Kukura <rkukura@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Update username -> name in token response.

Tokens validation responses contain user information. The API docs
seem to indicate token["user"]["name"] contains the username but
currently the auth_token.py middleware checks for
token["user"]["username"]. This updates that check and the tests.

Fixes bug 955563

Change-Id: Ib2fbf6fcea87f7066394cf14c18158f1e5eeaf06

As I suggested on novaclient, I wonder if it would make sense to provide the old forms of the argument names for backwards compatibility; we could remove them for the Folsom release.  (It'd also be cool if the backwards-compatibility options emitted a deprecation warning, but…)"}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2012-03-14 16:06:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Kevin, for glance only --auth_token was present in diablo.  We can add it, is it necessary to be backward-compatibile for something introduced in E3?'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-03-14 16:11:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

That's why I'm asking instead of -1'ing :)  If the majority of these weren't present in diablo, then I guess I'm fine with straight-up transitioning…"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-03-14 16:34:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'd definitely be in favor of keeping the old options in Glance as Kevin suggested. They don't currently conflict with anything else here as in Keystone."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-03-14 16:47:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Looked in to this more: it turns out that we only supported --auth_token on the command line, while we depended on env vars for the rest of our auth params. Knowing that, I would only ask that we support --auth_token for essex as a deprecated flag, while we can go ahead and change the other flags.'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2012-03-14 17:04:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-03-14 17:11:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Change CLIAuth arg names

Change the argument names used for common Keystone authentication per the
updated http://wiki.openstack.org/CLIAuth:

--auth_url -> --os_auth_url
--password -> --os_password
--username -> --os_username
--tenant_id -> os_tenant_id
--tenant_name -> os_tenant_name
--auth_strategy -> --os_auth_strategy
--region -> os_region_name
--auth_token -> os_auth_token (--auth_token is depricated but remains for compatability)

Fixes bug 954530

Change-Id: Ib7ff3325e5885852aeb3fcca9c5ad665b611e020

commit_message:
Add note about cache config options

The image cache configuration needs to be duplicated between glance-api.conf
and glance-cache.conf. This adds a note in the documentation to help clarify
that fact.

Change-Id: I125a56fecadc89d127570581c3ddb5d3faa3475c

commit_message:
Update docs for CLI changes to nova, keystone

* update cli docs to use current env vars and options (flags) for
  authentication via keystone per http://wiki.openstack.org/CLIAuth

Change-Id: If3c363877b89be3ed7d282aa6f7f241ebc0d9711

added parameters security_group, user_data and availability_zone
to the create servers method

removed excess param entries

Change-Id: I504f94ecf4d0c6a3ec408c56c13291741e805f35

commit_message:
libvirt/connection.py: Set console.log permissions

A required call to libvirt_utils.chown() was lost in
this weeks changes to get_console_output() for file
based console logs.

Fixes bug 955351

Change-Id: Ib8da92c1ff025f10a939c33b87495ffdef0d4da3

commit_message:
Allow errored volumes to be deleted

 * Allow volumes with no host set to be deleted from db
 * Allow volumes in state error to be deleted
 * Replicates code from nova-manage command
 * Fixes bug 953594

Change-Id: Ia8b4594a626df58f030406b12dd003f5c9215612

the ./run_tests.sh fails because of change in forms, still working on it'}, {'account_id': 2654, 'date': '2012-03-05 06:36:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 741, 'date': '2012-03-06 03:02:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Looks good, but I'm not at a computer I can test it on!

Thanks for finishing this out :) Its been on my ever growing todo list for ages!

What are the chances of this landing in Essex at this point?"}, {'account_id': 2455, 'date': '2012-03-06 21:57:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

When editing a group, in the [Source Group] dropdown the name of the current group is present, but when selecting it, the following error occur:
http://db.tt/fE5wZSrT

Maybe the current group should be removed from the dropdown to avoid these error messages, smth like this:

    source_group = forms.ChoiceField(label=_('Source Group'),
                                        required=False)

    def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs):
        self.fields['source_group'].choices = [s for s in security_groups if str(s[0]) != kwargs.get("initial", {}).get('security_group_id', 0)]

Also, as I see, the logic for hiding the dropdown is only applied in modal window, while this form could be displayed in a non-modal view as well:
http://db.tt/p2duC365'}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2012-03-06 22:01:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: (6 inline comments)

A few initial comments inline. Cant promise there aren't more since I haven't run the code yet.

However, just FYI, this won't be merged until after the RC candidate has been branched from master and master moves to Folsom. We're past both string and feature freeze, and this trespasses on both.

We'll definitely get this in, it's just gonna need some more work and have to wait a little while."}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2012-03-06 22:01:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Sorry. Forgot to add my vote on the review. See previous comments."}, {'account_id': 2654, 'date': '2012-03-07 03:37:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (6 inline comments)

thanks for the feedback, working on it right now'}, {'account_id': 2654, 'date': '2012-03-07 03:58:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 2455, 'date': '2012-03-07 16:31:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

I've added one inline comment. Also, this patch has no way to pass Jenkins, because of 4 PEP8 violations. 

During the test, adding a group worked fine, but adding a CIDR value failed. This could be a problem in Nova API - I am not aware what's the status of this change there and if I was with the "correct" Nova version. Just FYI.'}, {'account_id': 2654, 'date': '2012-03-08 02:26:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 2654, 'date': '2012-03-08 02:28:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

adding both source group and CIDR should now work as expected.
it failed because the clean() didn't convert the '' to None, and nova api cannot handle it.
the unit test should now catch this as well."}, {'account_id': 543, 'date': '2012-03-09 22:58:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Functionality works great but the layout for the fields now extends the dialog length quite a bit: http://i.imgur.com/iyaZ0.png

Is there some way we can put those fields in a single line like it was before?"}, {'account_id': 2654, 'date': '2012-03-10 02:14:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 2654, 'date': '2012-03-10 02:15:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

someone messed with the css, fixed it'}, {'account_id': 1205, 'date': '2012-03-11 03:34:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2012-03-12 22:51:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

The functionality is good. A few notes:

  1. use the event delegation as noted on the review for the tooltip hiding.

  2. there's still some odd overlap on the field widths. Looks like the width if the input is larger than the width of the container it's in so they fit on one line but spill out of the box...

  3. It'd be nice if there were an indicator in the dropdown list that there was the CIDR, and then, separately, there were the security groups. You could do this with the HTML optgroup tag and a divider in the list."}, {'account_id': 2654, 'date': '2012-03-13 07:51:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 2654, 'date': '2012-03-13 07:55:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

@gabriel, i submitted change according to your advice 1 and 2
1. the cidr field hiding is now handled via delegation
2. fixed the weird overlapping on field width

as for point 3, i dont know how to add that without making big changes to how form renders, maybe this should be postponed to another bug/wishlist ticket?'}, {'account_id': 2654, 'date': '2012-03-13 08:13:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 2654, 'date': '2012-03-13 08:14:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

@gabriel, added the group indicator as suggested for point 3

i forgot that django form choicefield already support this'}, {'account_id': 543, 'date': '2012-03-13 19:15:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2012-03-15 00:39:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-15 00:45:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Verified

commit_message:
add source group rule interface in security groups edit

 * fixes bug 860780
 * continues from abandoned https://review.openstack.org/3268
 * implements UI https://nebula.notableapp.com/posts/391efe1b94711ec4527b6f72a61e789b6a4a54b7
 * modified test to accomodate change
 * fix .form-field width from 96% to 90% to prevent weird overlap

Change-Id: I77af442ea4c0408556bfed8c2d1669b860219f66

commit_message:
Updating ec2 credentials verbiage.

  * Makes it more clear that you are also receiving your access
    and secret key in an rc file, instead of just your x509 certs.
  * If user already has ec2 credentials, return them, otherwise create.
    Prior to this fix, every time you downloaded a new bundle, you would get
    a new access/secret key pair.
  * Fixes bug 947647
  * Fixes bug 953530

Change-Id: Ifdbdf0036bfbaacae2e525fd6791f83aa947f3ff

commit_message:
Change CLIAuth arg names

Change the argument names used for common Keystone authentication per the
updated http://wiki.openstack.org/CLIAuth:

--auth_url -> --os_auth_url
--password -> --os_password
--username -> --os_username

Fixes bug 954528

Change-Id: I7e956e74de8192957eee87d155b2e5338c8942f0

[{'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-03-14 20:29:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-03-14 20:35:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

please review this based on the quality of:

 * reverting to previous logic (not the previous logic)
 * with caching around the logic
 * the backporting of https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/1991fd682563474dab1f299a5c8842d2637fe887'}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-03-14 20:37:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1082, 'date': '2012-03-14 20:55:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I've done some sniffs of the metadata service with this patch in place.  It at least fixes the problems that caused cloud-init to not boot completely (the block-device-mapping issues).

Also, the 2 tests I've ran are with cirros's 'ec2metadata' and:
 python -c 'import boto.utils, pprint; pprint.pprint(boto.utils.get_instance_metadata())'

the output of those definitely look better."}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-03-14 21:05:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

ran boto.utils.get_instance_metadata() twice, the logs show only a RPC call to the network service to map the address to an instance.

http://pastie.org/pastes/3596391/text

While the http logs show 0.2 seconds for response times, the total time for both boto calls was 0.4 seconds.

    > time python -c '...'
    real: 0.229s
    > time python -c '...'
    real: 0.113s"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-03-14 22:15:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Looks like you successfully preserved the bugfix I laid on top of your code.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-03-14 22:26:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

commit_message:
General cleanup

* Reorder imports
* Remove unused code
* Add missing copyright header in glance.api.v1.members
* Pass in 'pool' to glance.store.scrubber.Scrubber._cleanup
* Fix NameError in glance.api.v1.images.Controller: request -> req
* Fix except block in glance.notifier to properly catch multiple exceptions

Change-Id: I30d895b5ff1246e8d637720ef2f4aacab9cf7ede

[{'created': '2012-03-14 20:25:11.000000000', 'message': 'Import cfg module directly if not in path

If openstack.common is not installed, but another module has declared
the openstack namespace an ImportError is thrown since the common doesnt
exist in the openstack namespace. This falls back to importing cfg
directly from ./openstack/common/cfg.py.

Also ensures that openstack/__init__.py exists in the destination

* Fixes LP951197

Change-Id: I88c26fb7cc1aed97e66b068e4f0562b1f00b2b29
'}]
commit_message:
Import cfg module directly if not in path

If openstack.common is not installed, but another module has declared
the openstack namespace an ImportError is thrown since the common doesnt
exist in the openstack namespace. This falls back to importing cfg
directly from ./openstack/common/cfg.py.

Also ensures that openstack/__init__.py exists in the destination

* Fixes LP951197

Change-Id: I88c26fb7cc1aed97e66b068e4f0562b1f00b2b29

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-03-13 20:27:34.000000000', 'message': 'Small change to staticweb with container reques...

Small change to staticweb with container requests. Before, a request
to a container that had no x-container-meta-web-index and no
x-container-meta-web-listings would pass the request on to the proxy
server. Now, it will 404 by default and only pass the request on if
x-web-mode is explictly set to false.

This mostly important to folks that are using staticweb with an
external service that uses authenticated requests and x-web-mode set
to true, in which case the above 404 previously would return the
container listing (you were authenticated after all). Unauthenticated
requests would have received 401s anyway.

Change-Id: Ifd321a8a076a79c1e119c5259a40bf08defdbe3c
'}, {'created': '2012-03-13 22:17:46.000000000', 'message': 'Small change to staticweb with container reques...

Small change to staticweb with container requests. Before, a request
to a container that had no x-container-meta-web-index and no
x-container-meta-web-listings would pass the request on to the proxy
server, even if x-web-mode was set to true. Now, if x-web-mode is set
true, it will 404.

This mostly important to folks that are using staticweb with an
external service that uses authenticated requests and x-web-mode set
to true, in which case the above 404 previously would return the
container listing (you were authenticated after all). Unauthenticated
requests would have received 401s anyway.

Change-Id: Ifd321a8a076a79c1e119c5259a40bf08defdbe3c
'}]
commit_message:
Small change to staticweb with container reques...

Small change to staticweb with container requests. Before, a request
to a container that had no x-container-meta-web-index and no
x-container-meta-web-listings would pass the request on to the proxy
server, even if x-web-mode was set to true. Now, if x-web-mode is set
true, it will 404.

This mostly important to folks that are using staticweb with an
external service that uses authenticated requests and x-web-mode set
to true, in which case the above 404 previously would return the
container listing (you were authenticated after all). Unauthenticated
requests would have received 401s anyway.

Change-Id: Ifd321a8a076a79c1e119c5259a40bf08defdbe3c

commit_message:
Make fixed_ip_disassociate_all_by_timeout work.

Fix an issue in the SQL api where fixed_ip_disassociate_all_by_timeout
was getting an array of tuples instead of IDs from a model_query.

This should resolves issues where fixed IPs don't get dissassociated
via the network managers periodic task.

Fixes LP Bug #953708.

Change-Id: Iac485cdcda072ee248237e6c4a31113685f5b980
