commit_message:
Change CLIAuth arg names

Change the argument names used for common Keystone authentication per the
updated http://wiki.openstack.org/CLIAuth:

--auth_url -> --os_auth_url
--password -> --os_password
--username -> --os_username
--tenant_name -> os_tenant_name
--region_name -> os_region_name

All old args are depricated but available for backward compatibility.

Fixes bug 954531

Change-Id: Ic67c447e4e4b8d793f587c789cecd149446194f3

commit_message:
Removing registry spec from docs

* Rewords how we refer to to our 'reference' implementation of the registry
  API. glance-registry is an implementation detail of the main glance API, not
  an example of a community-driven API spec
* Remove duplicate 'gettingstarted' information
* Fixes bug 954554

Change-Id: I889f61a399c398897f2146b756b2c3c310847718

commit_message:
Change CLIAuth arg names

Change the argument names used for common Keystone authentication per the
updated http://wiki.openstack.org/CLIAuth:

--auth_url -> --os_auth_url
--password -> --os_password
--username -> --os_username
--tenant_id -> os_tenant_id
--tenant_name -> os_tenant_name
--region -> os_region_name

All old args are depricated but available for backward compatibility.

Fixes bug 954532

Change-Id: I26f8e0cf491549f5836c4079ff86e4823c0ef9a7

[{'created': '2012-03-13 22:11:08.000000000', 'message': "User.authorized_tenants is now a cached property.

This allows moving the call to get authorized tenants out of
the middleware (which was a wasteful call on many requests),
and allows the value to be re-used anytime it's accessed more
than once per request.

Fixes bug 942074.

Change-Id: Ic09b15adbffb16c0358bb28aec73345cc01834ad
"}]
commit_message:
User.authorized_tenants is now a cached property.

This allows moving the call to get authorized tenants out of
the middleware (which was a wasteful call on many requests),
and allows the value to be re-used anytime it's accessed more
than once per request.

Fixes bug 942074.

Change-Id: Ic09b15adbffb16c0358bb28aec73345cc01834ad

commit_message:
Add exercise that boots an instance from a volume.

 * Launches a cirros builder instance
 * Mounts a disk to the builder instance
 * Creates a bootable volume from builder
 * Launches the volume-backed instance
 * Update glance syntax
 * Don't require instance-to-web communication (that only works with
   fully configured floating ips)
 * Add footer/header

Addresses bug 954430

The sendfile call is redriven after select()ing to ensure the

A maximum of five consecutive retries is tolerated to avoid
spinning forever.

commit_message:
Retry sendfile on EAGAIN or EBUSY

Addresses bug 954430

The sendfile call is redriven after a blocking select()
to ensure the socket is now writeable.

Change-Id: I68242c76593405f78e30324c2913cead63463c77

commit_message:
Moved ajax updating from Action to Row.

This fixes the problem of having to "hide" the update action
in the row's actions column. Fixes bug 948397.

Additionally, added some protection for spillover between
the attrs dictionary on action instances. Fixes bug 954592.

FWIW, the code involved in the AJAX updating is largely identical,
it's just been moved from Action to Row and had few data accessors
renamed to account for the differing relation to Table and Row.
This also allowed the javascript to be significantly cleaner.

Change-Id: Ic8932a33ca6956a56c8eee09bb0a4d1f59e0ab3a

messages:
[{'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2012-03-08 23:43:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

This matches what we do in libvirt, which has proved a successful approach for fixing the problem described in the bug.'}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-03-09 09:39:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I think the mac address was chosen because udev does something bad when you bundle the image on certain linux systems with different addresses.

vishy worked on this a couple years ago'}, {'account_id': 34, 'date': '2012-03-09 16:19:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Reading: https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/908194

It looks like this only gets halfway to a fix and needs the bridge to be associated to a vnet as well?'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2012-03-09 16:24:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: No score

Yes, if the bridge being used by OpenStack does not have any physical ethernet devices enslaved, then it becomes necessary to create a dummy TAP device with a fixed, low number, MAC address and enslave that. If you don't do this, then since there is no physical eth, the bridge will still assume the MAC of the lowest numbered guest TAP device. This is undesirable because it results in the bridge switching MACs when that guest starts/stops."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-03-09 17:24:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Daniel, is this any worse than what we already have in regards to not having a device enslaved?  I think it is pretty rare these days to create br100 without having it enslaved to a real eth device, it would only be on single machine test installs'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2012-03-09 17:46:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This patch is definitely better than what we have today, and fixing the final edge case, wouldn't invalidate/conflict with this patch - it can easily be a separate followup."}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2012-03-09 17:47:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-03-10 04:01:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-03-10 04:04:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-10 04:18:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified

(2 inline comments)

Overall, I agree this is a useful check we want to have in our repository. 


However, it cannot be accepted as it is, for the following reasons:

1) Unit tests fail; and apparently the quantum service also fails at startup. The following traceback might help; it seems just that sqlalchemy should be explicitly imported


Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/salvatore/git/quantum/quantum/tests/unit/test_database.py", line 37, in setUp
    db.configure_db({'sql_connection': 'sqlite:///:memory:'})
  File "/home/salvatore/git/quantum/quantum/db/api.py", line 68, in configure_db
    connection_dict = sqlalchemy.engine.url.make_url(options['sql_connection'])
NameError: global name 'sqlalchemy' is not defined

2) Pep8 errors, line 67 in quantum/db/api.py exceeds 80 characters

3) [Minor] I think that in terms of style guidelines we discourage inline imports, despite them being useful in many circumstances. So unless, strictly necessary I would suggest to move those imports to the top of the module.

Thanks for submitting this patch. Looking forward to an updated patchset'}, {'account_id': 2634, 'date': '2012-03-14 16:51:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-14 16:51:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-03-14 14:58:37.000000000', 'message': "Update transfer_vhd to handle unicode correctly.

Python 2.4's shlex implementation doesn't seem to like unicode.
This updates the XenServer migration plugin so it converts to
ascii before shlex'ing the rsync args.

Fixes OSAPI resizes when using XenServer.

Fixes LP Bug #955064.

Change-Id: I7f2681bfe64ccde449a87c68b9739866a381a213
"}]
commit_message:
Update transfer_vhd to handle unicode correctly.

Python 2.4's shlex implementation doesn't seem to like unicode.
This updates the XenServer migration plugin so it converts to
ascii before shlex'ing the rsync args.

Fixes OSAPI resizes when using XenServer.

Fixes LP Bug #955064.

Change-Id: I7f2681bfe64ccde449a87c68b9739866a381a213

commit_message:
Body of http responses included in Swift error msg

The body of http responses is included in error messages from
swift.common.client and bin/swift if the body exists

Includes changes requested by Juan Martinez

Includes changes requested by David Goetz

Fixed pep8 warnings

Bug 949843

Change-Id: Ib998280762b084dd46f8c0f4524eed20513de82b

commit_message:
add content-range headers to partial HTTP responses triggered by "Range:" requests as required by the HTTP protocol

The S3 layer should not filter out content-range response headers as they are part of the
protocol and expected on a partial response.

Change-Id: I2ae0775b5e039d1d505c44ec235ea32370dba1bc

commit_message:
Provide updated install info for Fedora and EPEL.

This patch removes the old RHEL 6 installation instructions and provides
updated information.  It's essentially just a couple of links over to
the Fedora wiki where the latest information is being maintained.

In passing change a section title from "Installing OpenStack Compute on
..." to "Installing on ...".  It seemed a bit redundant since the
chapter is called "Installing OpenStack Compute".

Change-Id: I7321fe5d9dba5e02a5e12761e4249dfd6dc37430

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-03-08 18:32:54.000000000', 'message': "Fix populating tenant chooser

With latest keystone, I'm background errors like reported here:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/942074
http://paste.openstack.org/show/5214/

The keystone admin API doesn't seem to allow looking up tenants
for an unscoped token, so let's use the publicURL (the default).

Change-Id: I61a6c2c29313e3a284a773dcd5f74515fe39fd55
"}]
commit_message:
Fix populating tenant chooser

With latest keystone, I'm background errors like reported here:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/942074
http://paste.openstack.org/show/5214/

The keystone admin API doesn't seem to allow looking up tenants
for an unscoped token, so let's use the publicURL (the default).

Change-Id: I61a6c2c29313e3a284a773dcd5f74515fe39fd55

subject: fix unicode triggered failure in AuthManager
messages:
[{'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-02-22 10:24:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

This affects master too I think.
Could you commit against that and then we can cherry pick back to stable?

Also the bug isn't auto referenced from gerrit
due to the formatting. I suggest:

    fix unicode triggered failure in AuthManager

    * Always return a string from AuthManager._build_mc_key()
    * Fixes bug 938375

Also I'd change the fix. str() assumes that the unicode,
can be encoded to ASCII. It's better to use utils.utf8(),
to more safely convert to string, and in the ASCII case
the result will be the same

cheers"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-02-22 11:34:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Hm. Need to think about this as I had hoped for "copy and paste" commands to work throughout this guide. By adding angle brackets, that's not longer the case. subject: Remove duplication between volume extension and api.
messages:
[{'account_id': 708, 'date': '2012-02-28 17:03:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-02-28 19:29:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Do not submit

I'm all for code reduction, but there is one major point here we may have overlooked. We are about to start reducing some of the oddities in the volumes v1 spec, which we expect to fix in the volumes endpoint. However, we can not change the volumes extension. So I'm worried that by doing this we will either hinder our ability to fix the v1 spec, or we will make breaking changes to the extension. Let's discuss this with the greater community before making a decision on this review."}, {'account_id': 708, 'date': '2012-02-28 19:50:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I think, we should prevent code duplication anyway, or we will end up with partial changes in both code and tests like I bumped into (nova-volume behavior change was reflected in endpoint, but not in extension).

We can add API v1 conformance testing to extension so that if we change something that changes extension behavior, there will be some notification (failed tests). It should use some properly faked volume.api or volume driver to make sure that extension works no matter what.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-28 20:09:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Do not submit

The other issue is volume is likely to move into its own project during folsom and we will continue to need to support the extension for a while. I agree with waldon that this should not be combined.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-03-14 06:03:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-03-14 06:03:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity'}]

commit_message:
Remove duplication between volume extension and api.

All common parts are left only at nova.api.openstack.volume, all
duplications removed from nova.api.openstack.compute.contrib.
Unified tests as well.

Change-Id: I44a0ba62bc9920e86a32527dfc9e445a933d1042

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-03-14 05:21:07.000000000', 'message': 'Adds client function for quantum 'detail' actions.

Fixes bug 834017. This commit:
1. Adds library functions to exercise the 'detail' actions
   for quantum ports and networks.
2. Modifies client function 'show_port_details()' to invoke
   'detail' action. And added 'show_port()' function to do the
   regular call without 'detail'.
3. Adds CLIs to exercise the new client function calls. The CLIs
   options that end with '_det' invoke equivalent 'detail' action.
   Note that with this change the previous CLI 'show_port' shall now
   show concise info about a port ie. only ID and state, while 'show_port_de
   can be used to list the details information about a port viz. ID, state
   and its attachment.
4. Modifies OutputTemplate class to add support for templates with 3 or more
   level attributes (eg. "Port interface: %(port.attachment.id)s) and
   templates containing list of multilevel-attributes (eg. "Ports:
   %(network.ports|ID: %(id)s\t\tinterface: %(attachment.id)s)s")
5. Introduces run_tests.py, run_test.sh, tools/with_venv.sh and
   tools/install_venv.py files for python-quantumclient
   (fiels copied and adapted to python-quantumclient from main quantum/ dir)
6. Added respective unit tests and verified them.

Change-Id: I464824abea5ef0c99c466b71c1e883b492d60d62

commit_message:
Adds client side functions for quantum 'detail' actions.

Fixes bug 834017. This commit:
1. Adds library functions to exercise the 'detail' actions
   for quantum ports and networks.
2. Modifies client function 'show_port_details()' to invoke
   'detail' action. And added 'show_port()' function to do the
   regular call without 'detail'.
3. Adds CLIs to exercise the new client function calls. The CLIs
   options that end with '_detail' invoke equivalent 'detail' action.
   Note that with this change the previous CLI 'show_port' shall now
   show concise info about a port ie. only ID and state, while
   'show_port_detail' can be used to list the detailed information about
   a port viz. ID, state and its attachment.
4. Modifies OutputTemplate class to add support for templates with 3 or more
   level attributes (eg. "Port interface: %(port.attachment.id)s) and
   templates containing list of multilevel-attributes (eg. "Ports:
   %(network.ports|ID: %(id)s\t\tinterface: %(attachment.id)s)s")
5. Added respective unit tests and verified them.

Change-Id: I464824abea5ef0c99c466b71c1e883b492d60d62

commit_message:
Remove references to deprecated ec2 authorizor.

 * remove replace_pipeline
 * removes references to sysadmin and netadmin roles
 * removes references to admin ec2 api
 * fixes bug 953744
 * related fix in nova: https://review.openstack.org/#change,5024

Change-Id: I8792dae0157b8596a5f946670742411781fe47c0

(1 inline comment)

Hi again :)

So, to address little style comments from a review and pushing those changes to the original changeset, do the follow:ing in your local topic branch:

 # Make changes needed by review...
 git commit --amend -a
 git review

Remember to always use a topic branch (i.e. not your local copy of master) when doing work on stuff. Just makes things easier.

Best,

-jay'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-03-11 17:02:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Another quick hint... :)

If you want to pull this exact changeset into a local branch on your computer, do this:

 git review -d 5212

And then you can make the fixups and do a:

 git commit --amend -a
 git review

And it will push to Gerrit, with this changeset amended.

Also remember that you do not need to add any details to the commit message about little style fixups. Just keep the commit message a succinct message about the bug and the fix.'}, {'account_id': 2634, 'date': '2012-03-11 17:05:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-03-11 17:06:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
Spring cleaning in docs

This is nearly all about spiffing up stack.sh to improve comment
content and readability.  Shocco has been fixed so the comments and
code line up properly again in http://devstack.org/stack.sh.html so
the comments are being cleaned up and updated.

Change-Id: I2add0351106fb832fbf6e236cbd90630df97dec3

commit_message:
Fixes LP#934492 - Allow Null Name

* Modify bin/glance to allow nullable name property,
  in accordance with API spec

This changeset also adds a fix for Swift functional
tests where HTTPS locations weren't being properly
constructed.

Change-Id: Ibad2d3ab150ee347449b4e9b3b9e941ce7a0fc6f

subject: Ensure driver opts are registered in cli.
messages:
[{'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-03-13 21:19:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Thanks Eoghan, I've pushed this fix:

       def main(self):
           for k in ['identity', 'catalog', 'policy', 'token']:
  -            driver = utils.import_object(self.conf[k].driver, self.conf)
  -            if hasattr(driver, 'db_sync'):
  -                driver.db_sync()
  +            name = 'keystone.%s.core.Manager' % k
  +            manager = utils.import_object(name, self.conf)
  +            if hasattr(manager.driver, 'db_sync'):
  +                manager.driver.db_sync()"}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-03-13 21:29:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Superceeded by markmc's fix."}]

"}]

Ensure driver opts are registered in cli.

Avoids 'keystone-manage db_sync' failure ...

commit_message:
Remove generation of quantum/vcsversion.py.

The quantum/vcsversion.py module is generated by the quantum project's
setup.py, so python-quantumclient's setup.py should not also generate
it. It is not used in python-quantumclient. Fixes bug 944363.

Change-Id: Ib7dd646aaa24aefa7f6f28397232f52550705e31
Signed-off-by: Bob Kukura <rkukura@redhat.com>

commit_message:
add progressive interval delay, extra checks in ajax row update polling

 * fix bug 948429, increase interval multiplier if row no update
 * fix bug 948432, with following changes
   * update row with replace only if html differs (changes found)
   * do not trigger ajax request if row action is expanded
   * still trigger ajax request if row checkbox is checked
     and the checkbox is remained checked if row replaced
 * fix bug 953268, see last point above

Change-Id: I487407289305694025a555f1dc96317d17416307

commit_message:
Downgraded required version of WebOb to 1.0.8.

 * Maintaining version parity with other OpenStack projects is
   essential to packaging efforts and shared installation (devstack).
 * fixes bug 950374

Change-Id: I9b16f29a3641df7063ec80bc86b03b4857776b42

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-03-13 01:56:30.000000000', 'message': "Volume delete action cleanup.

  * Shows the table-level delete action.
  * Shows the delete action for error'd volumes, but disables the
    button and adds a tooltip explaining why it can't be deleted.
    Thanks to Tres and John for the suggestions. Fixes bug 953581.
  * Links up the volume name in the volumes table to the volumes
    detail page. Fixes bug 953469.

Change-Id: Ie4017c7fbb8e2f22e130ba5f973c7608a24aedfb
"}]
commit_message:
Volume delete action cleanup.

  * Shows the table-level delete action.
  * Shows the delete action for error'd volumes, but disables the
    button and adds a tooltip explaining why it can't be deleted.
    Thanks to Tres and John for the suggestions. Fixes bug 953581.
  * Links up the volume name in the volumes table to the volumes
    detail page. Fixes bug 953469.

Change-Id: Ie4017c7fbb8e2f22e130ba5f973c7608a24aedfb

Oh, just realized one more thing. The file
doc/src/docbkx/openstack-api-site/src/wadls/compute-api/src/os-compute-devguide.xml 
Is not actually published from this repo, instead it is in:
https://github.com/openstack/compute-api/tree/master/openstack-compute-api-2/src
Sorry for the confusion, the files in doc/src/docbkx/openstack-api-site should be put into the compute-api repo soon.'}, {'account_id': 1419, 'date': '2012-03-07 15:38:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Fix bug 948275 Document --enable_instance_password

Added a new section on compute API configuration, moved API rate limiting
into that section, and added a new section on generic API configuration.

Also updated compute API developers guide to include a reference to
the new flag.

Change-Id: I6bc1a346e744c627d6a8304430a64c545742bcf7

[{'created': '2012-03-12 18:14:44.000000000', 'message': "Refresh SSL cfg after parsing service catalog entry

Fixes bug 949838

Ensure connection kwargs are re-evaluated after the keystone service
catalog publicURL for glance has been parsed for potential SSL usage.

Otherwise the attempt to create a HTTPS connection will fail with
missing __init__() args if the client is using auth-free SSL
(i.e. is neither validating the server's cert, not authenticating
itself to the server).

Change-Id: I31c2083616297a64541cc6648d420e724baaf9f4
"}]
commit_message:
Refresh SSL cfg after parsing service catalog entry

Fixes bug 949838

Ensure connection kwargs are re-evaluated after the keystone service
catalog publicURL for glance has been parsed for potential SSL usage.

Otherwise the attempt to create a HTTPS connection will fail with
missing __init__() args if the client is using auth-free SSL
(i.e. is neither validating the server's cert, not authenticating
itself to the server).

Change-Id: I31c2083616297a64541cc6648d420e724baaf9f4

commit_message:
Hack to fixup absolute pybasedir in nova.conf.sample

We want to avoid e.g. /home/markmc or /Users/vishvananda in this
file.

/usr/lib/python/site-packages is pretty dumb too, but it's suffices
as an example.

Change-Id: I851841a30ca01790c7b5a9b6bdbd160f4a84467c

[{'created': '2012-03-13 06:38:46.000000000', 'message': "Refactor glance id<->internal id conversion for s3

 * Moves nova.image.s3.S3ImageService functions for converting
   between glance ('image_uuid') and internal (db) ids to ec2utils:

       get_image_id => ec2utils.glance_id_to_id
       get_image_uuid => ec2utils.id_to_glance_id

 * Refactors ec2utils.glance_id_to_id to create a new S3Image
   object associating a glance id to an internal id if such a
   mapping does not already exist.  Previously, only calls to
   nova.api.ec2.cloud.CloudController.describe_images would
   add new mappings, but now any attempt to convert a glance id
   to an internal id will succeed, resolving bug 948286.

 * Adds 2 convenience methods to ec2utils, as per bcwaldon:

       ec2_id_to_glance_id
       glance_id_to_ec2_id

 * Since this is a strict refactor and only streamlines existing
   well-tested functionality, this change includes no new tests.

Change-Id: I810afe05223228df1bcc20a0ac688d8c62c472b4

commit_message:
Refactor glance id<->internal id conversion for s3

 * Moves nova.image.s3.S3ImageService functions for converting
   between glance ('image_uuid') and internal (db) ids to ec2utils:

       get_image_id => ec2utils.glance_id_to_id
       get_image_uuid => ec2utils.id_to_glance_id

 * Refactors ec2utils.glance_id_to_id to create a new S3Image
   object associating a glance id to an internal id if such a
   mapping does not already exist.  Previously, only calls to
   nova.api.ec2.cloud.CloudController.describe_images would
   add new mappings, but now any attempt to convert a glance id
   to an internal id will succeed, resolving bug 948286.

 * Adds 2 convenience methods to ec2utils, as per bcwaldon:

       ec2_id_to_glance_id
       glance_id_to_ec2_id

 * Since this is a strict refactor and only streamlines existing
   well-tested functionality, this change includes no new tests.

Change-Id: I810afe05223228df1bcc20a0ac688d8c62c472b4

While you are editing launch time, can you also look at:

Specifically I'm worried that translating the launch time into the particular format that is expected by ec2 will break the string sorting you are using.  We might have to do something tricky like:

commit_message:
Sort results from describe_instances in EC2 API.

Fix bug 827619.

This bug pointed out that EC2 sorts the results of of describe_instances
by the launch time.  Make our implementation of the EC2 API behave the same
way.  Previously, instances coming out of the db API were sorted by the
key we wanted, but in the opposite order.  You can now specify both a
sort key and order.  The behavior is the same by default, but the EC2
API sets the parameter to do an ascending sort.

Change-Id: Ifd0bc79ad4c4c8c45809dbb1ac2dadf8abcfd4c3

subject: Removes default use of obsolete ec2 authorizor.
messages:
[{'account_id': 24, 'date': '2012-03-07 10:47:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 1155, 'date': '2012-03-07 23:11:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

So one thing about this patch that is worth noting, is that it maintains a layer of policy at the http api layer.  For the core osapi, policy is generally enforced at a lower level, although extensions are generally implemented with one-off policy controls at the http api layer.

I'm considering the trade-offs between higher and lower level policy enforcement.  From a user-perspective, I think it is clearer to provide higher-level controls.  For example - I think most users looking at the proposed policy.json file would understand the purpose and function of the ec2 section.   The rest of the file is comparatively cryptic.

Lower level controls are possibly more elegant from the developer standpoint, but then create a documentation problem, since we have to somehow communicate to deployers how to map the internal controls to the external api calls, and keep that mapping communicated accurately over time.  As it stands, I think it will be rather tricky to document how rbac works in the osapi."}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-03-07 23:20:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

one of the reasons for doing low-level RBAC policies was to hope that extensions / changes in the API didn't let people sneak through any cracks 

example: perhaps a certain role (accounting) is allowed only to describe resources, but an extension was added to create a special type of VM (cloudpipe for instance).  If the user is restricted to the lower-level - cannot create VM - then even this new command is properly restricted

------------------------------

should we allow both types of checks? 

 * by default we set policies on the public API commands, but allow policies to be created on the internals for experts?"}, {'account_id': 1155, 'date': '2012-03-13 05:52:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1155, 'date': '2012-03-13 05:58:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1155, 'date': '2012-03-13 05:59:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

jesse - I think that your comment about potentially adding api-level controls in addition to lower-level controls is valid.  However, for essex, it probably makes the most sense to just remove the default use of the deprecated ec2 authorizor from the pipeline, and just use low-level controls for both ec2 and osapi.  For Folsom, we can re-explore possibilities for user-configurable rbac at the api layer.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-03-13 06:45:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 642, 'date': '2012-03-13 16:05:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

lgtm.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-13 16:16:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified

Build Successful

commit_message:
virt/firewall: NoopFirewallDriver::instance_filter_exists must return True

Otherwise, virt.libvirt.connection.ensure_filtering_rules_for_instance()
results in infinite loop.
And eliminate NullFirewallDriver as it's same to NoopFirewallDriver.
This patch fixes bug 953781.

Change-Id: I7936b3c69e9269041defd1ef7e5dda2de1f96dab

commit_message:
fixed list warn when ip allocated to missing inst.

Update 'nova-manage fixed list' so it prints a warning if an IP
is allocated to a deleted/missing instance.

Fixes LP Bug #953685.

Change-Id: I72b7ad2cb01e31cf9bb6cab904ab10d8769a3526

commit_message:
Configure nova-rootwrap

* Nova runs as the same user as the rest of devstack and due to the
  sudo configuration for devstack itself it may be possible that
  root subprocess execution that doesn't go through utils.execute() will
  not be caught by the expected sudo failure.

Fixes bug 944373

Change-Id: I0554b3850a59d065059f8ad349c8ff8fb7cfa132

commit_message:
Fix iso8601 import/use and date comparaison.

- Store the unix time from iso8601.parse_date to compare against
  time.time.
- on a WSGI environement the import don't get passed to the methods from
  __init__ use a self. variable.
- Fixes bug 951603.
- Add unit tests.
- Add iso8601 to test-requires.

Change-Id: Ia8af8b203d1310d5ae6868c3a14dfdf68d6e5331

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-03-12 10:46:51.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid nova-manage floating create <IP addr>/32

Fixes bug 951161

Avoid the counter-intuitive use of the /32 range to indicate a specific
individial IP address.

Instead a floating IP for a specific individual address is created by
dropping the range specifier altogether, e.g.:

commit_message:
Avoid nova-manage floating create <IP addr>/32

Fixes bug 951161

Avoid the counter-intuitive use of the /32 range to indicate a specific
individial IP address.

Instead a floating IP for a specific individual address is created by
dropping the range specifier altogether, e.g.:

  nova-manage floating create 192.168.1.150

Change-Id: I54b124e961accefa47f6faa7f201809c545c3fa5

commit_message:
improve speed of metadata

 * don't load every possible answer, only do what is needed
 * cache instance data for a given address for a 15 seconds
   using either memcache or fake memcache (in-memory).
   This means only a single queue/db lookup for multiple calls
   to metadata service
 * add cache expirey to fake memcache (don't grow forever)
   and move it to nova.common.memorycache

Addresses Bug #851159

Change-Id: Icf794156e055b18915b8b5be9ba2ab97d2338bbe

commit_message:
Update floating auto assignment to use the model

 * addresses bug 928819
 * previously submitted changes (#change,4236)
 * unit tests added that don't use fakes for everything
 * added testAssert to check assignment process
 * added call to deallocate as well

Change-Id: I46503e6e88031a6e1ab3ac76163402091168c6b0

subject: Fix or skip tests that fail in diablo except for glance import issue.
messages:
[{'account_id': 979, 'date': '2012-03-02 10:46:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Looks good!

Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2012-03-02 18:45:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-03-03 01:16:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

David, I'm getting some errors when running this branch against a local Diablo devstack install:

http://paste.openstack.org/show/5971/

The only one I'm really concerned about is the empty string keypair one. The others I believe have to do with b0rked resizing in Diablo and the first one is a weird anomaly I'm tracking down..."}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2012-03-03 04:43:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Yeah, I had resize off because my test cluster uses kvm but maybe it doesn't work in diablo even without that."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-03-05 16:48:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I'm still seeing the empty string error happen...

======================================================================
ERROR: The server's RAM and disk space should be modified to that of
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/jpipes/repos/tempest/tempest/tests/test_server_actions.py", line 97, in test_resize_server_confirm
    self.client.wait_for_server_status(self.server_id, 'VERIFY_RESIZE')
  File "/home/jpipes/repos/tempest/tempest/services/nova/json/servers_client.py", line 147, in wait_for_server_status
    raise exceptions.BuildErrorException(server_id=server_id)
BuildErrorException: Server 14 failed to build and is in ERROR status

======================================================================
ERROR: The server's RAM and disk space should return to its original
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/jpipes/repos/tempest/tempest/tests/test_server_actions.py", line 115, in test_resize_server_revert
    self.client.wait_for_server_status(self.server_id, 'VERIFY_RESIZE')
  File "/home/jpipes/repos/tempest/tempest/services/nova/json/servers_client.py", line 147, in wait_for_server_status
    raise exceptions.BuildErrorException(server_id=server_id)
BuildErrorException: Server 15 failed to build and is in ERROR status

======================================================================
FAIL: Keypairs with name being an empty string should not be created
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/jpipes/repos/tempest/tempest/tests/test_keypairs.py", line 143, in test_create_keypair_with_empty_name_string
    self.fail('empty string')
AssertionError: empty string

----------------------------------------------------------------------
Ran 105 tests in 484.334s'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2012-03-06 01:52:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

There is something very strange going on. I pulled this change onto my laptop and ran the keypair test against my trystack account. The first time I ran it, the test failed exactly as in the last message. I put in a print to see if the return code was 200 or something else and the test succeeded. I then removed the print and could no longer get the test to fail after running it many more times.'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2012-03-06 04:17:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

OK, so it seems that diablo behavior when creating a key with an empty string is different depending on whether such a key already exists. The strange test results are caused by the fact that it incorrectly let's you actually create the key, but then will not let you remove it. So the test cleanup will not actually remove the key. I think that explains the difference between what Jay saw and what I saw. My system was no longer "clean" and so did not show the error. So there are really two diablo bugs here. I think we need to skip this test for now.'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2012-03-12 19:11:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-03-12 20:03:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Running locally now...'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-03-12 20:25:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

Other than resize tests, passing locally.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-12 20:26:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-tempest-pep8/83/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-tempest-merge/123/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-12 20:26:13.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-03-12 19:48:39.000000000', 'message': "Fix double-quoted service names

The Keystone service template parser doesn't do any quote interpolation,
it just splits on ' = ' and passes the two parts on. So we just remove
the quotes for now.

Fixes bug 943523

Change-Id: Ia2a10ec18db1a82f23f36200b0cdef84b4f78155
"}]
commit_message:
Fix double-quoted service names

The Keystone service template parser doesn't do any quote interpolation,
it just splits on ' = ' and passes the two parts on. So we just remove
the quotes for now.

Fixes bug 943523

Change-Id: Ia2a10ec18db1a82f23f36200b0cdef84b4f78155

Does this include the ephemeral drive as well?'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-03-10 00:46:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

It does not.  Snapshots are just for the root drive.  Hence the name ephemeral.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-03-10 00:51:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Make snapshots with qemu-img instead of libvirt

 * snapshot is only supposed to snapshot the root drive, whereas
   libvirt snapshots snapshot the memory and all attached disks
 * removes silly qemu_img flag
 * fixes bug 946830

Change-Id: I6afc9dbaa855f06864cd5a37f89ad63555e35d23

the quotes for now.

commit_message:
Bug #922356 QuantumManager does not initiate unplug on the linux_net driver

remove_gateway() being added to L3 driver API which gets invoked from
QuantumManager when a network is deleted. remove_gateway()
implementation for LinuxNetL3 calls unplug on the linux_net driver.

Change-Id: I42d12cf8653c61436e89e97eaa384f26ee2ed707

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-03-12 18:44:37.000000000', 'message': 'Fix linux_net.py interface-driver loading.

bug 950381

linux_net.py previously set the value of interface_driver based on a flag
when the module was loaded.  This breaks when nova-manage is used to
invoke anything using the interface_driver, as nova-manage loads the
nova.network.linux_net module before flags are properly set.  This patch
moves the initialization of the interface_driver variable to within a
function that will only be called once flags are properly loaded.

Note: this patch also fixes the unplug() action for the OVS vif-plugging
code to actually remove the device created to act as the gateway device.
Also tweaks the plug() to use the get_dev() method, reducing duplicate
code.

Change-Id: I97a17c010d4d6a67e2340a81315da00775c67eea
'}]
commit_message:
Fix linux_net.py interface-driver loading.

bug 950381

linux_net.py previously set the value of interface_driver based on a flag
when the module was loaded.  This breaks when nova-manage is used to
invoke anything using the interface_driver, as nova-manage loads the
nova.network.linux_net module before flags are properly set.  This patch
moves the initialization of the interface_driver variable to within a
function that will only be called once flags are properly loaded.

Note: this patch also fixes the unplug() action for the OVS vif-plugging
code to actually remove the device created to act as the gateway device.
Also tweaks the plug() to use the get_dev() method, reducing duplicate
code.

Change-Id: I97a17c010d4d6a67e2340a81315da00775c67eea

messages:
[{'account_id': 177, 'date': '2012-03-08 21:58:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I think the answer to the question is no because nova-manage contains this:


1799                 backend = db.sm_backend_conf_get_by_sr(ctxt,
1800                                                        params['sr_uuid'])

...

1804             if backend:
1805                 if len(backend) > 1:
1806                     print 'error: Multiple backends found with given sr_uuid'
1807                     sys.exit(2)


implying that multiple may be returned. Perhaps all of this behavior should be changed? The error here doesn't seem to be handled very well."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-03-08 22:03:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Perhaps.  I suspect the code using it probably came about because someone at first assumed it returned a single response, then discovered that was not the case, so compensated by checking lengths.  Is sm_backend_conf_get_by_sr() used anywhere else?  Where does the data it returns get set?'}, {'account_id': 177, 'date': '2012-03-09 15:38:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

That indeed is the only place it is used. It says in db/api.py """Get a specific SM Backend Config.""" so maybe it should have a first() and nova-manage is wrong in expecting multiple?

The only place they are created is through nova-manage which seems to always create them with sr_uuid=None. Maybe this all should be changed to generate a uuid? When testing it manually, it always has the sr uuid as None.'}, {'account_id': 177, 'date': '2012-03-09 16:09:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 177, 'date': '2012-03-09 16:13:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (3 inline comments)

commit_message:
Fix nova-manage backend_add with sr_uuid

Fixes bug 950964

Remove FIXME in db.sm_backend_conf_get_by_sr
Add first() to sm_backend_conf_get_by_sr query
Change db/api.py:sm_backend_conf_get_by_sr to call correct impl method
Have nova-manage generate an actuall sr_uuid instead of always 'None'
Actually update backend values when specifying uuid

Change-Id: I620da4563d8c936b5a072c4683ae145280104fc2

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-03-08 09:49:58.000000000', 'message': "Don't use glance when verifying images.

Using glance means that admin contexts need to know how to use
keystone when that is enabled. Its safer to avoid calling glance
at all from inside the periodic task.

This should resolve bug/934464.

Change-Id: Ib730e3f57721fca7080d90ae80b5f8916c1dc76c
"}, {'created': '2012-03-09 00:44:12.000000000', 'message': "Don't use glance when verifying images.

keystone when that is enabled. Its safer to avoid calling glance
at all from inside the periodic task.

This should resolve bug 934464.

Change-Id: Ib730e3f57721fca7080d90ae80b5f8916c1dc76c
"}]
commit_message:
Don't use glance when verifying images.

Using glance means that admin contexts need to know how to use
keystone when that is enabled. Its safer to avoid calling glance
at all from inside the periodic task.

This should resolve bug 934464.

Change-Id: Ib730e3f57721fca7080d90ae80b5f8916c1dc76c

'}, {'account_id': 191, 'date': '2012-03-08 16:28:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

I think that releasing the dhcp associated with the particular address is more efficient in this case as update_dhcp() calls get_dhcp_hosts() which is a pretty terrible function. It does 1 + (2 db lookups for every associated ip in the network) to get the vif and instance. So if you were to deallocate 3 IPs from a network with 50 associated IPs, that will result in 101+99+97=297 db calls total. To me, update_dhcp() seems to have a different functionality, something like running on a host when it boots or when everything needs to be setup at once.

I was doing an interview yesterday when you mentioned this so I'm sorry if I missed something. Why did you decide to use update_dhcp() instead of the seemingly way more efficient release_dhcp() which makes no db calls?"}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-03-08 20:22:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-03-08 20:28:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-03-08 20:54:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-03-08 20:55:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
Fix live-migration in multi_host network

 * call teardown after live migration
 * call update a second time after migration for dhcp
 * moves the instance state update into post_live_migrate
 * completes the fix for bug 939060
 * fixes bug 947326

Change-Id: I042567573b9bb46381c5447aa08e83cd1916b225

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-03-08 14:26:27.000000000', 'message': 'Simply & unify console handling for libvirt drivers

Currently the libvirt.xml.template file contains the following
console definitions

        <!-- The order is significant here.  File must be defined first -->
        <serial type="file">
            <source path='${basepath}/console.log'/>
            <target port='1'/>
        </serial>

        <console type='pty' tty='/dev/pts/2'>
            <source path='/dev/pts/2'/>
            <target port='0'/>
        </console>

        <serial type='pty'>
            <source path='/dev/pts/2'/>
            <target port='0'/>
        </serial>

There are multiple things wrong with this

 - LXC and Xen guests don't honour the <serial> elements
 - The <console> element shouldn't have any <source> element
   of 'tty' attribute set when type=pty, since they are
   dynamically allocated
 - The <console> element will ignored if the <serial>
   element is set and the hypervisor supports this
 - It doesn't say why multiple serial elements are used
   or why the order is important. The reason is that
   the QEMU pty driver throws away data when no client
   is connected. This means we can't use it as a basis
   for the persistent log file. Instead we need two
   separate serial ports, the first of which is used for
   the logfile

In addition in the nova/virt/libvirt/connect.py class the
'get_console_output' method has separate special-case
handling for Xen and LXC despite the fact that both work
in the same way.

All this can be significantly simplified, to unify console
handling across all libvirt drivers. First replacing all
the existing XML with just

  #if $type == 'qemu'
        <serial type='file'>
            <source path='${basepath}/console.log'/>
        </serial>
        <serial type='pty'/>
  #else
        <console type='pty'/>
  #end if

This lets Xen/UML/LXC just use a regular PTY based console,
while special casing QEMU. It is minimal XML, letting
libvirt automatically fill in other attributes

In the code, the get_console_output method can remove the
explicit checks for Xen/LXC and instead be conditionalized
based on what the XML shows.

Finally calling out to 'virsh ttyiname' is pointless since
nova already has a connection to libvirt which can be used
to fetch the XML & extra the TTY path.

Change-Id: I6a966df4ea72e07dbc227683c4225670984fc507
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Simply & unify console handling for libvirt drivers

Currently the libvirt.xml.template file contains the following
console definitions

        <!-- The order is significant here.  File must be defined first -->
        <serial type="file">
            <source path='${basepath}/console.log'/>
            <target port='1'/>
        </serial>

        <console type='pty' tty='/dev/pts/2'>
            <source path='/dev/pts/2'/>
            <target port='0'/>
        </console>

        <serial type='pty'>
            <source path='/dev/pts/2'/>
            <target port='0'/>
        </serial>

There are multiple things wrong with this

 - LXC and Xen guests don't honour the <serial> elements
 - The <console> element shouldn't have any <source> element
   of 'tty' attribute set when type=pty, since they are
   dynamically allocated
 - The <console> element will ignored if the <serial>
   element is set and the hypervisor supports this
 - It doesn't say why multiple serial elements are used
   or why the order is important. The reason is that
   the QEMU pty driver throws away data when no client
   is connected. This means we can't use it as a basis
   for the persistent log file. Instead we need two
   separate serial ports, the first of which is used for
   the logfile

In addition in the nova/virt/libvirt/connect.py class the
'get_console_output' method has separate special-case
handling for Xen and LXC despite the fact that both work
in the same way.

All this can be significantly simplified, to unify console
handling across all libvirt drivers. First replacing all
the existing XML with just

  #if $type == 'qemu'
        <serial type='file'>
            <source path='${basepath}/console.log'/>
        </serial>
        <serial type='pty'/>
  #else
        <console type='pty'/>
  #end if

This lets Xen/UML/LXC just use a regular PTY based console,
while special casing QEMU. It is minimal XML, letting
libvirt automatically fill in other attributes

In the code, the get_console_output method can remove the
explicit checks for Xen/LXC and instead be conditionalized
based on what the XML shows.

Finally calling out to 'virsh ttyiname' is pointless since
nova already has a connection to libvirt which can be used
to fetch the XML & extract the TTY path.

Change-Id: I6a966df4ea72e07dbc227683c4225670984fc507
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Set 'dhcp_server' in _teardown_network_on_host.

Update _teardown_network_on_host so that it sets 'dhcp_server'
on network objects for compatability when using flat dhcp with
linux_net.

Fixes LP bug #951642. ('Network' object has no attribute 'dhcp_server')

Change-Id: I53ab99155ea6e4163c9eb0b28b765f962f99a2b1

subject: add user password strength checks using cracklib
messages:
[{'account_id': 2340, 'date': '2012-03-06 13:49:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi!

We found that users can be created with no password or with weak passwords as there are no checks done at all.

A production environment could benefit from strong password checks for users. Cracklib should be available on most systems and it provides different mechanisms for password checking like length-checks, entropy and dictionary-based words.'}, {'account_id': 2340, 'date': '2012-03-06 16:54:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2012-03-06 19:23:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Do not submit

I agree that there's an issue here, but I don't believe this is the solution. There are three separate issues here:

1. The password field should be required if the identity backend supports setting passwords. Bug here: https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/948310

2. Horizon should be aware of the identity backend's capabilities. Blueprint here: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/horizon/+spec/identity-backend-type

3. Password validation is not a one-size-fits-all problem. While it's good to offer guidance on strong vs. weak, different organizations have vastly different requirements for what is an acceptable password. Bug here: https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/948317

Overall, I *might* be convinced that a javascript-based password strength meter was a valuable addition if the rest of the community was behind it. But adding another Python dependency here for a problem that we can't solve appropriate is a non-starter, sorry.

Thanks for the patch, though! You raised some good issues!"}, {'account_id': 2340, 'date': '2012-03-12 10:34:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Abandoned

I'll abandon this since a different implementation is being discussed in launchpad."}]

[{'created': '2012-03-06 13:42:29.000000000', 'message': 'add user password strength checks using cracklib

Change-Id: I5e4110a265f9048ddaccf20f84dcc3af3e82bb1c
'}, {'created': '2012-03-06 16:54:38.000000000', 'message': 'add user password strength checks using cracklib

[{'created': '2012-03-09 15:30:18.000000000', 'message': "Sub in InstanceLimitExceeded in overLimit message

Fixes bug 950768

Previously the error message in the 413 overLimit response returned
by the OS compute API was missing a parameter subsitution indicating
the actual quota that was breeched:

This is now properly reported as:

commit_message:
Sub in InstanceLimitExceeded in overLimit message

Fixes bug 950768

Previously the error message in the 413 overLimit response returned
by the OS compute API was missing a parameter subsitution indicating
the actual quota that was breeched:

  'Quota exceeded: code=%(code)s'

This is now properly reported as:

  'Quota exceeded: code=InstanceLimitExceeded'

Also a potentially useful log message is no longer discarded.

Change-Id: I7e1f8b078329a6530bb7d7ea3b006ff578cdcdd3

commit_message:
When the glance client throws an Exception at Horizon, catch it and determine if it is an HTTP exception. If it is, recast it as a glance_client.ClientConnectionError so that Horizon can deal with it in a better manner. Fixes 951200

Change-Id: I7cbfa74d340d25d523ab8fb18138f5cf7d33a9d9

commit_message:
Remove update lockmode from compute_node_get_by_host

Fixes bug #948066

This commit removes the usage of an update cursor so postgres
doesn't raise the error below
SELECT FOR UPDATE/SHARE cannot be applied to the nullable side of
an outer join

Change-Id: Ia1ede22df38d5f6a24372e0ad8ec25151ad195c7

commit_message:
Allows row status to be determined as the aggregate of multiple columns.

Instances table handles both status columns correctly now. Fixes bug 948419.
Syspanel instances table no longer has "launch instance" action. Fixes bug 952609.
Allows ajax-updating for volumes table. Fixes bug 948396.

Change-Id: I8657c79d0ab7ec5972cc7c4886d7f009a1710876

subject: Add instructions for pip install via easy_install.
messages:
[{'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-03-09 20:23:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Ah, my fault.  I'm not sure that python-pip would be the best idea, though.  I would prefer to see python-setuptools installed and then 'easy_install pip' to ensure that a more recent version is installed than the one packaged with 10.04.  Thoughts?"}, {'account_id': 1603, 'date': '2012-03-09 20:49:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1603, 'date': '2012-03-09 20:51:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Think you're right. That's basically what I did on my SAIO anyway."}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2012-03-09 21:22:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-03-09 22:18:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2012-03-09 22:33:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-03-09 22:53:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

I realized that the fedora instructions have the same issue.  Do you or any of the reviewers know what is required to get pip installed via setuptools on fedora?'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2012-03-09 23:52:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: No score

Maru, I'm against pip. That's why it's not mentioned in Fedora instructions. Fedora users are invited to follow instructions, which I verified to work, and stay away from pip."}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2012-03-10 17:37:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: No score

Pete, the instructions already merged to trunk have this in the Fedora instructions:

pip install openstack.nose_plugin

That's what they're trying to figure out, what's the best way to get openstack.nose_plugin installed on Fedora?"}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-03-10 18:03:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Pete: I'm not sure I follow your being 'against pip'.  Is this a personal prejudice, or is there some reason a Fedora user would be advised not to use it?  My optimistic guess is you would prefer using rpm packages to raw python packages for the SAIO, and that you plan on producing an rpm of  openstack.nose_plugin and adding it to a repo somewhere to make this scenario possible."}, {'account_id': 1603, 'date': '2012-03-10 21:15:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

The included fedora instructions throw me off a bit in general since they actually instruct you to install swift from packages:

"yum install openstack-swift openstack-swift-proxy openstack-swift-account openstack-swift-container openstack-swift-object"

However, since the SAIO is (or I guess was) intended as dev environment later on we tell users to grab the code from github and roll with a "python setup.py develop" (http://swift.openstack.org/development_saio.html#getting-the-code-and-setting-up-test-environment)

Do we need to split the instructions and do a section for an SAIO deployment (using packages) and one for a dev SAIO?'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2012-03-10 23:06:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I think Derek added that pip. He actually asked me to review before he posted the change but I must've missed it.

To address Florian's comment, from the phylosophical standpoint, Fedora tends towards packaging supremacy. That's why I packaged git-review and swauth: a number of users and developers won't touch anything that's not prepackaged, even if they are going to check it out from git anyway.

This culture may be a subject to change. Derek came onboard in December and obviously he has no inhibition against the unpackaged.

I reflexively documented installing SAIO from RPMs, because that's what I know to work. It was all verified."}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2012-03-10 23:36:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Nah, that's our fault. Maru just added it when the tox stuff landed. I guess we can just leave the Fedora instructions lagging for a bit until Pete (or someone) gets it caught up. The CI guys want tox, etc. for their work, so I don't want to revert that by any means.

Can we go ahead an approve this change, it just changes the Ubuntu instructions anyways?"}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2012-03-10 23:47:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2012-03-11 21:59:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

looks like the consensus is that this change is good. merging.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-11 22:00:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Fails

Build Failed 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-swift-python26/2/ : FAILURE 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-swift-python27/4/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-swift-merge/119/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-11 22:49:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Build Failed 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-swift-python27/4/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-swift-merge/119/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-swift-python26/3/ : FAILURE'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-11 23:53:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-swift-python27/4/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-swift-merge/119/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-swift-python26/4/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-11 23:53:49.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

Add instructions for pip install via easy_install.

Add a line item to easy_install pip since we now need to pip install
openstack.nose_plugin. Fixes bug 951019

subject: Fixes the cli documentation of user/tenant/roles
messages:
[{'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-03-08 06:17:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Deepak - good update, thank you!'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2012-03-08 16:17:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(4 inline comments)

Thanks for separating this out -- much easier to review!

There's a few commands documented that no longer exist, and quite a few commands that are still undocumented (ec2-*, endpoint-*, user-password-update, catalog, discover).

I'd be happy to +2 assuming what *is* documented is accurate; we can keep the bug in progress and do subsequent changes to document the other commands if you prefer."}, {'account_id': 1814, 'date': '2012-03-08 17:00:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1814, 'date': '2012-03-08 17:03:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Please re-examine the change. All the commands modified by me are manually tested.
I like the idea of pushing the undocumented commands subsequently. Thanks for the support. :)'}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-03-08 17:34:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2012-03-08 20:13:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

looks good, but i'd prefer the commit message to be updated"}, {'account_id': 1814, 'date': '2012-03-09 03:12:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1814, 'date': '2012-03-09 03:17:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Fixed the commit comment. Please re-examine the change.'}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-03-09 18:47:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-03-11 01:55:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Deepak, termie is referring to your git commit message...

It should be something like:


    Fixes documentation of cli for user/tenant/roles
    
    Fixed the subcommands and basic misconfiguration mentioned in bug #948211
    
    Change-Id: I2a8491c35f346d120581156ae1743d07c3c11fd0

OpenStack (and others) prefer the first line to be 50 character summary, then a blank line, then the details.

http://tbaggery.com/2008/04/19/a-note-about-git-commit-messages.html'}, {'account_id': 1814, 'date': '2012-03-11 03:47:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 1814, 'date': '2012-03-11 03:59:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Thanks Jesse for the link. Please reexamine the change.'}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-03-11 04:41:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-03-11 06:31:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-11 06:37:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified

create service endpoints in sample data

Enable creation of endpoints by setting ENABLE_ENDPOINTS environment
variable. Works with Catalog SQL backend.

commit_message:
Move ENABLED_SERVICES to stackrc.

allow us to do things like that :

ENABLED_SERVICES="$ENABLED_SERVICES,swift"

in localrc instead of having to copy the full config from stack.sh.

Fixes bug 951598.

Change-Id: I17e168473540760bcfa40a752ff2c266bd9b7044

commit_message:
Update docbook element usage.

This patch updates this chapter will more docbook element usage.  Most
of the changes fall into these categories:

1) Use <filename> for filenames.

2) Use <literal> around a lot of things, such as configuraiton options
and values.

3) Remove the "default: " from the cells in the "Default" column of most
of the tables, as it seemed redundant.

Change-Id: I3749faf060bcfa9ec9236b2c9961839fd60b9ee0

subject: Allow soft_reboot to work from more states:
messages:
[{'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-03-10 00:30:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

It doesn't make a lot of sense to me to reboot an instance that is not running. In response to the bug report: why not use 'nova start <instance>'?"}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-03-10 00:42:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-03-10 00:44:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

In the case of a guest shutdown/crash/host reboot the vm state will still be in active, even though the power state is shutoff or shutdown.  I modified the patch to update the vm_state to shutoff in these situations as well so that start will work in more cases, but I still think it is valuable to have reboot work properly if the vm_state shows active and the power state is actually in shutoff/shutdown/crashed.

Sync power states can take a while to update the state of the vm, so this seems valuable.'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-03-10 01:48:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-03-10 03:41:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Ok, thanks for the explanation, Vishvananda.'}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-03-10 11:01:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-10 11:24:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-integration-tests-devstack-vm/2407/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-merge/1839/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-unittests/1494/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-pep8/3220/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-10 11:24:17.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

Change-Id: Icaa071ac59700385d9985315b99c0468415e444a
'}, {'created': '2012-03-10 00:42:58.000000000', 'message': 'Allow soft_reboot to work from more states:

Change-Id: Icaa071ac59700385d9985315b99c0468415e444a
'}]
commit_message:
Allow soft_reboot to work from more states:

 * update sync_power_states to update other states
 * only attempt to shutdown the domain if it is running
 * attempt to start the domain from shutoff and crashed
 * fixes bug 951235

Change-Id: Icaa071ac59700385d9985315b99c0468415e444a

For reasons currently unknown, apt-get seems to install
an unusably old version of python-cloudfiles in some
small subset of cases. To avoid that frustration for the
users it does affect, this patch moves python-cloudfiles

commit_message:
Moves python-cloudfiles dependency back to PIP.

For reasons currently unknown, apt-get seems to install
an unusably old version of python-cloudfiles in some
small subset of cases. To avoid that frustration for the
users it does affect, this patch moves python-cloudfiles
back to being installed by pip instead.

Fixes bug 931269.

Change-Id: I4c2e17ddcc0c0d327b3810b4fd4db117076df069

commit_message:
Remove calls to service-create in devstack for now.

 * The recommended backend for essex is the template backend.
 * Fixes bug 950213

subject: Make sure we have a port number before int it.
messages:
[{'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-03-02 12:08:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-03-02 17:19:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Haven't had a chance too look at this yet... this doesn't appear to run w/ keystone however.

Regarding the SmokeStack results the Ubuntu results essentially have had keystone disabled since KSL. The Fedora run which uses keystone fails however (and that looks valid to me)."}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-03-02 17:30:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-03-05 13:23:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-03-05 13:25:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

@Jesse this should look better like that?

@Dprince: I have tested all the use cases I can think with the configuration directives, but I am not sure where SmokeStack bugs out. What is the auth_token configuration for the failed test? (can't seem to sees it in the logs)."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-03-06 18:55:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Do not submit

Okay. Looking a bite more closely at this....

As near as I can tell this branch adds a feature that will essentially overwrite the Admin port setting (35357) with the port of the auth_url (5000 by default). My tests would all fail with this because I have auth_url set to something like http://127.0.0.1:5000/.

As I understand it auth_url should be used exclusively for client redirects and as such I think this may cause serious issues.

---

That said I do however think the auth_url configuration parameter is poorly named. Perhaps client_auth_url would be a better alternative. Still... for legacy users we probably shouldn't change behaviour here."}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-03-08 14:36:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-03-08 14:41:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Dprince, thanks I misunderstood what default_auth_uri does, I have changed the review to only fix bug 944720 (and do some clean-up along the way).

the auth_uri directive is definitively misnamed. What do you think if we rename those variables and just use URI instead of individual config directives  like auth_port/auth_host etc...'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-03-08 18:42:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Chmouel:

Perhaps look into changing the config name in Folsom?

---

Thanks for the changes. This one looks good to me.'}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2012-03-08 22:21:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

looks fine to me, i assume auth_location isn't being used anywhere"}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-03-10 07:30:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

based on Chmouel's comments inline, assuming the removing auth_location from the s3_token is OK. approving"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-10 07:35:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified

Build Successful

https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-keystone-merge/957/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-10 07:35:55.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

commit_message:
Make sure we have a port number before int it.

- Remove unused auth_location in s3_token along the way.
- Fixes bug 944720.

Change-Id: Ib6e48511d09798868c5ca3fa00472525bc9f8823

subject: Add token caching via memcache.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6, 'name': 'Joe Heck', 'email': 'heckj@mac.com', 'username': 'heckj'}, {'_account_id': 112, 'name': 'Jesse Andrews', 'email': 'anotherjesse@gmail.com', 'username': 'anotherjesse'}, {'_account_id': 357, 'name': 'Devin Carlen', 'email': 'devin@openstack.org', 'username': 'devcamcar'}, {'_account_id': 494, 'name': 'termie', 'email': 'termie@openstack.org', 'username': 'termie'}, {'_account_id': 866, 'name': 'Chmouel Boudjnah', 'email': 'chmouel@chmouel.com', 'username': 'chmouel'}, {'_account_id': 1132, 'name': 'Brian Waldon', 'email': 'brian@waldon.cc', 'username': 'bcwaldon'}, {'_account_id': 1297, 'name': 'Joshua Harlow', 'email': 'jxharlow@godaddy.com', 'username': 'harlowja'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 357, 'date': '2012-02-24 00:47:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-02-24 18:22:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(2 inline comments)

Generally great - two questions inline."}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2012-02-25 04:59:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(1 inline comment)

so frustrating doing reviews in that file, so much messy style... anyway, this seems pretty fine, nothing that is done in this file will ever feel "good" until it is re-written, so if we can move the import into init (and set self.memcache_client or whatever) i think we're good'}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-02-25 17:09:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

termie, I think the reason for putting import memcache there is so that the system works without the memcache python library.

there might be a better way to do this though'}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-02-25 17:21:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@JoeHeck -- For swift there is already a middleware for caching we let the user used that instead of our own if it's there. I think having a memcache token middle-ware shipped with openstack-common should address those thing. 

@AnotherJesse, @Termie: What about something like that :

on top :

try:
  import memcache
except ImportError:
  import_memcache = False

and later down in the __init__ use that ?

There is a lot of ugly parts in this file unfortunately and totally agree that a rewrite needs to be done, some of those bugs are addressed with a full update to latest auth_token from keystone legacy (probably without the superfluous features), WDYT ?"}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2012-02-27 17:45:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

if you just put 

if memcache_hosts:
  import memcache
  self.memcache_client = memcache.Client(asdasd)

and later use self.memcache_client that should be fine'}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-02-29 09:04:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

DO you mean that you don't want to use the env variable?

PS: I am waiting that 4675 is getting merged to rebase against it."}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-03-01 21:40:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

pretty much going to be a rewrite at this point...  hopefully it is much cleaner for the rewrite though'}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-03-02 15:53:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-03-02 15:56:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Did a rewrite^H^H^Hrebase against the latest auth_token. I tried to simplify the code and removed the 'using swift cache' feature since I don't see much advantages in there. A few bug has been corrected as invalid token are now cached  properly (ie: the invalidity)."}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-03-02 17:09:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(5 inline comments)

probably need to do a couple of rounds with this.

Also don't like the use of word "claims" (we revised the wording)'}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-03-02 17:58:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-03-02 18:31:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (4 inline comments)

more nits'}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-03-08 06:15:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-03-08 06:28:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(2 inline comments)

couple of nits on logging/feedback for debugging, otherwise good"}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-03-08 07:10:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-03-08 07:16:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-03-08 17:26:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-03-08 19:34:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(1 inline comment)

"}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-03-08 20:49:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

This look good but I agree with Brian about standardising that variable, in Swift the memcache_servers is used as well.'}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2012-03-08 22:29:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(7 inline comments)

a few style nits"}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2012-03-09 06:38:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Is there a reason we aren't abstracting out the memcache "api" here and allowing an object/class which supports the get/put api to be used also (nova has a fake memcache using memory that does this). It seems useful for that to be here also. Memcache isn't everyone's cup-o-tea....'}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-03-09 09:26:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

josh ++

having a common tool is the goal - but given our current release timeline, it will probably land in openstack core in folsom.  

I'm experimenting here: https://github.com/cloudbuilders/smallcache"}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-03-09 13:38:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-03-09 13:48:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: (2 inline comments)

I have addressed termie's comment and changed memcache_hosts to memcache_servers as this would align to other openstack components, I don't think users were already using memcache_hosts before

I have inline questions for Jesse about the expirations.

@termie for time comparaison time.mktime(ts.utctimetuple()) works maybe you confuse with http://pastie.org/private/kqdeeocgpoy0wrvffoa"}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2012-03-09 18:23:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

@jesse, that looks nice and a good start (a background thread that does cleanup/expiration might be neat, ??)'}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-03-09 22:02:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-03-09 22:07:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

updated & response to chmouel'}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-03-09 22:13:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: (2 inline comments)

responses'}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-03-09 22:21:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I didn't realise about the multiple endpoints, thanks."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-03-09 23:14:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(4 inline comments)

"}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-03-10 03:47:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-03-10 03:47:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: (4 inline comments)

fixed?'}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-03-10 04:14:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

removing chmouel's code:


    def _parse_time(self, timestamp):
        # avoid using the datetime parser external library by
        # doing the parsing ourselves.
        timestamp = timestamp.replace('Z', '')
        timestamp = datetime.datetime.strptime(timestamp,
                                               '%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S')
        return time.mktime(timestamp.utctimetuple())

but putting it here in case we need to add the ability to fall back to this if iso8501 library isn't there..."}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-03-10 04:17:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-03-10 04:34:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-03-10 04:39:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-03-10 04:40:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-03-10 04:42:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-03-10 04:43:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-03-10 05:04:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-03-10 05:06:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-03-10 05:49:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17: Looks good to me (core reviewer)
