commit_message:
Add token caching via memcache.

- Fixes bug 938253
- caching requires both python-memcache and iso8601

Change-Id: I23d5849aad4c6a2333b903eaca6d4f00be8615d3

subject: Add 'nova-manage export auth'
messages:
[{'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-02-27 06:58:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

At first glance, this looks like a new feature and unsuitable for the stable branch, but as "a fix for nova-manage shell export" it makes more sense

So, Brian - could you update the commit message with some more details around what is broken with 'shell export' that 'export auth' fixes? The blueprint just refers to "user_id == user_name and project_id == project_name" and "update the entities in the nova database with a proper ids from keystone" but it seems like we're not addressing either of those?

Also, while you're at it, add this to the commit message:

  (cherry picked from commit 0f9326a1adcb257a296646e68edfd9d8d17146db)

'git cherry-pick -x' does this automatically and it's useful to keep track of where things came from on master

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-02-27 17:01:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Sure, I'll amend the commit message with the cherry-pick comment. 

I understand this is new functionality (it's not a bugfix for 'nova shell export', either), but it is absolutely necessary for Diablo and Essex to allow users to transition to Keystone. It's not a user-facing feature, so I'm not worried about it causing any issues on that front."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-02-27 17:02:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-02-27 17:19:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thanks Brian. Yep, I get the idea but it would be nice to have more details i.e.

  could you update the commit message with some more details 
  around what is broken with 'shell export' that 'export

commit_message:
Add 'nova-manage export auth'

* Introduce ability to dump auth data to json blob for consumption by keystone
* Existing 'nova-manage shell export' generates invalid data (and is poorly named). It also attempted to output keystone client commands when Nova shouldn't have to understand that cli.
* Implements bp keystone-export-rewrite

(cherry picked from commit 0f9326a1adcb257a296646e68edfd9d8d17146db)

Change-Id: Ic8c0ade8350daa449fb6df7ad3c55c3ae2b0c2c7

commit_message:
Freeze tested requirements in tarball.

If we build the tarball in a venv, create and install a requirements.txt
file that we use at pip-install time to get install depends. Otherwise,
use pip-requires as the basis of the setup.py install_requires (so that
git urls will work)
Split deps needed by the library and deps needed for testing into different
files so that setup.py install doesn't install a bunch of testing stuff.
Use openstack-common as the basis of the requirements code, so added a
openstack-common.conf file.

Change-Id: Ib55dbb4625cb8ae36695ee4eee126c22740e56db

commit_message:
Implement TenantManager.get_tenant_by_name()

get_tenant_by_name() returns a tenant ref given a valid name

get_tenant_by_name_or_id() supports the addition of name lookups
in the shell to allow users to give a tenant name rather than ID
for command-line operations.

Commands that support tenant names:
user-list
user-create
tenant-get
tenant-create
tenant-update
tenant-delete
user-role-add
user-role-remove
ec2-credentials-create

Change-Id: I67cc12f21bdfcb159b8b07c2846059ac26452da0

commit_message:
Add endpoint commands help text

Makes the new endpoint-* commands help text consistient with the
other keystone commands.  Also removes 'nargs' from options that
require arguments.

commit_message:
Clean up setup and teardown for dhcp managers

 * use update_dhcp on teardown, not release_dhcp
 * clean up setup / teardown to not require vif and address
 * make dnsmasq only configure allocated ips
 * prepares the fix for bug 939060

Change-Id: Ie85860c5549339befee74c951ccb0d72a92f6d6c

subject: Fix issues with security group auths without ports.
messages:
[{'account_id': 24, 'date': '2012-03-07 21:14:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-03-07 21:21:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-03-07 21:21:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

rev2 just fixes the typoed bug number in the commit message.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-03-07 21:34:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

This code looks correct but I have a question from the linked bug
From the bug:

euca-authorize -P icmp -o test-ports test-ports

What happens if you specify a similar rule specifying only tcp or udp?  Does it open all ports?

For example:

euca-authorize -P tcp -o test-ports test-ports"}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-03-07 21:45:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Good call, Vish ... same problem if you do it with tcp or udp.

GROUP	1b011b516dc644bf816f87cf18ec8688	test-ports2	test wrong ports
PERMISSION	1b011b516dc644bf816f87cf18ec8688	test-ports2	ALLOWS	icmp	-1	-1	GRPNAME	test-ports2
PERMISSION	1b011b516dc644bf816f87cf18ec8688	test-ports2	ALLOWS	tcp	1	65535	GRPNAME	test-ports2
PERMISSION	1b011b516dc644bf816f87cf18ec8688	test-ports2	ALLOWS	udp	1	65536	GRPNAME	test-ports2


This patch enables all ICMP when the type/code isn't specified.  I'm thinking that for UDP and TCP it should just raise an error if ports are not specified.  Automatically opening everything seems bad.  I'm not sure what EC2 does, though."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-03-07 22:13:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

ec2 opens all ports if you specify a source group without specifying a protocol.
For Example,

euca-authorize -o test-ports test-ports

opens everything!

Through this api you actually can't specify source group with extra parameters, but since we do support it i think it makes sense to say a protocol w/ source group could open all ports / types, so 

euca-authorize -P tcp -o test-ports test-ports

opens all tcp

That said,

euca-authorize -P tcp test-ports

should fail.

The one I am unsure of is:

euca-authorize -P icmp test-ports

maybe that one should auto insert -1:-1, but for consistency i'm leaning towards fail as well."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-03-07 22:15:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

clarification: "Through this api [on ec2] ..."

ec2 only seems to support source group with no extra params, although I've been told you can set source groups with extra parameters through the soap api.

So since our implementation is a little more robust in this respect, I think the strategy in my last post makes the most sense'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-03-07 22:16:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thanks!  I'll keep working through this based on your input."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-03-07 23:47:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-03-08 00:13:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

very nice.  One more thing looks like you need a corresponding change at:

nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/security_groups.py:439

There is a bunch of duplicated code there that should probably be cleaned up eventually.  I wouldn't do it in this patch but it seems useful to make sure that the rule works the same through both apis."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-03-08 17:20:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-03-10 01:16:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-03-10 01:17:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

code was linked to the wrong bug 72 vs. 27, just updated to reference the right bug.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-03-10 03:45:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-10 03:55:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified

commit_message:
Fix issues with security group auths without ports.

Fix bug 946427.

There was a bug where a security group would get completely opened in
cases where only icmp, udp, or tcp should be opened.  For example, any
of the following three commands would result in opening everything:

    euca-authorize -P icmp -o test-ports test-ports
    euca-authorize -P tcp -o test-ports test-ports
    euca-authorize -P udp -o test-ports test-ports

This patch resolves this and these commands now only open the protocol
that was specified.  Unit tests have been added to verify the fix and
also verify that this only works when a source group is specified.
While the bug was originally reported against the EC2 API, the same
updates and similar unit tests have gone in to the equivalent code for
the OpenStack API.

Change-Id: I4c87c5f5f4ccee60c6c16da4e659d73ab3f4a34f

commit_message:
Move all EC2 cred creation to eucarc

* Remove credential creation from files/keystone_data.sh
* Remove EC2 cert setup from openrc
* Remove sourcing of ec2rc from stackrc
* Collect the above in eucarc
* Allow rc files to be sourced from other directories; based on Chmouel's
  4881 proposal but is simpler and doesn't actually change the directory
* Create S3 endpoint
* Get EC2 and S3 endpoints from Keystone service catalog
* Add EC2 credential checks to exercises/client-env.sh
* exercises/bundle.sh and exercises/euca.sh use eucarc

Updates:
* remove readlink -f to stay bash 3 compatible
* use service catalog
* create S3 endpoint

Fixes bug 949528

Change-Id: I58caea8cecbbd10661779bc2d150d241f4a5822e

commit_message:
Ensure that ip_forwarding is always enabled for compute and network

Libvirt gets this in most cases, but it can be disabled.  This is
belts + suspenders + super glue...

Fixes bug 885274

Change-Id: Ifb8d627689800b23cce02a623caa525cd17e507d

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-03-09 13:08:22.000000000', 'message': "Use cache='none' for all disks

The default QEMU disk cache mode has changed several times in
QEMU's history. This means OpenStack launched VMs have unpredictable
data consistency guarantees and performance characteristics. Using
cache=none bypasses the host page cache by using direct IO. This
ensures:

 - Consistent I/O performance for VMs
 - Avoids data loss on a host OS crash
 - Avoids data corruption of images during migration

Change-Id: I099dac55b8cfa1f0ec5d0e49d1d9ffbe4ae2560d
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Use cache='none' for all disks

The default QEMU disk cache mode has changed several times in
QEMU's history. This means OpenStack launched VMs have unpredictable
data consistency guarantees and performance characteristics. Using
cache=none bypasses the host page cache by using direct IO. This
ensures:

 - Consistent I/O performance for VMs
 - Avoids data loss on a host OS crash
 - Avoids data corruption of images during migration

Change-Id: I099dac55b8cfa1f0ec5d0e49d1d9ffbe4ae2560d
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

default values of other options. This helps eliminate hard-coded paths

commit_message:
Add pybasedir and bindir options

Add a pybasedir option so that it can be used for interpolation in the
default values of other options. This helps eliminate hard-coded paths
from the sample config file.

Also add a bindir option for similar reasons, but it also helps with
packaging.

Change-Id: Iadc746dcf2a24adbdf9bac945b5b330f01faeeb5

commit_message:
EC2 KeyName validation.

According to EC2 API Documentation, the keyname
is acccetable as a  alphanumeric characters,
spaces, dashes, and underscores.

As well as make sure that the keyname doesnt
exceed 255 characters.

Make sure that the key that is being created is valid.
Fixes bug 947750.

Change-Id: I083af7f2cbc417150fadb79b307083bb3ba229d6
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

I've pushed a fix for both of those here: https://github.com/markmc/nova/commits/source-security-group

A question for Jason or Trey - what I don't understand is why we're doing an RPC call at all here. Can we not get this from the network info cache in the DB?

I must say I find this info cache, legacy vs spectacular nw info, etc. stuff horrendously confusing :("}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2012-03-07 15:14:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Ah, yea, it was failing the test, since the test stub or whatever
wasn't returning the model.

> A question for Jason or Trey - what I don't understand is
> why we're doing an RPC call at all here. Can we not get 
> this from the network info cache in the DB?

We could, the rpc stuff here predates the "cache" by
a few weeks. Really this needs to be refactored out into
the compute manager and out of virt. Virt should only ever
use the nw_info passed into it.

> I must say I find this info cache, legacy vs spectacular
> nw info, etc. stuff horrendously confusing :(

I agree, we're in the middle of a huge refactor of the 
network bits that will have to continue into Folsom.
(Minus the spectacular=True stuff that's just poorly named
 params in the fakes)

We had hoped to get libvirt/xen updated quickly to use the
new network model stuff, but sadly timelines of other features
got in the way.'}, {'account_id': 2583, 'date': '2012-03-09 14:35:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 2583, 'date': '2012-03-09 14:40:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

commit_message:
Since 'net' is of nova.network.model.VIF class and 'ips' is an empty
list, net needs to be pulled from hydrated nw_info.fixed_ips(), and
appended to ips.

bug 942593

Change-Id: I9c2f55e300d1dad503b15c261027d988073e8e61

commit_message:
Fix dependency list generation corner cases

* Handle empty install lists in apt_get() and pip_install()
* pip_install now uses get_packages() to get the dependency list

Fixes bug 948714

Change-Id: I174a60976df18c670eab2067edcd1871c51d07d6

commit_message:
Fix typo in tox.ini.

My last commit message was right, the code was wrong.  It's tox:jenkins.
Commands are invalid in tox: sections, so we'll get pip freeze run
another way.

Change-Id: Iafa21ff47cf5e3d8f57676be93e2fa6a0d0ab9b4

[{'created': '2012-03-09 21:20:16.000000000', 'message': 'Glance cache updates to support Keystone Essex.

Glance caching updates to support keystone service tenants:

 * Update glance-cache-manage so that it supports the same style OS_
  environment variables and CLI options for auth that bin/glance does.

 * Updates registry/client so that it supports Keystone KSL style
  service tenants. As services no longer use admin_tokens this is
  a requirement to be able to use caching w/ KSL.

Fixes LP Bug #949486.

Change-Id: I8d0e56a9ec0d20ef56ed2ce8b860d987ae159e01
'}, {'created': '2012-03-09 22:51:22.000000000', 'message': 'Glance cache updates to support Keystone Essex.

Glance caching updates to support keystone service tenants:

 * Update glance-cache-manage so that it supports the same style OS_
  environment variables and CLI options for auth that bin/glance does.

 * Updates registry/client so that it supports Keystone KSL style
  service tenants. As services no longer use admin_tokens this is
  a requirement to be able to use caching w/ KSL.

Fixes LP Bug #949486.

Change-Id: I8d0e56a9ec0d20ef56ed2ce8b860d987ae159e01
'}]
commit_message:
Glance cache updates to support Keystone Essex.

Glance caching updates to support keystone service tenants:

 * Update glance-cache-manage so that it supports the same style OS_
  environment variables and CLI options for auth that bin/glance does.

 * Updates registry/client so that it supports Keystone KSL style
  service tenants. As services no longer use admin_tokens this is
  a requirement to be able to use caching w/ KSL.

Fixes LP Bug #949486.

Change-Id: I8d0e56a9ec0d20ef56ed2ce8b860d987ae159e01

messages:
[{'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-03-02 19:21:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

(1 inline comment)

Some additional doc request inline, but these changes don't need to wait for those."}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-03-02 21:02:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-03-02 21:02:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Yep, makes sense, so I added these:

nova-cert - The nova-cert service manages x509 certificates used as a public key authentication for launching virtual machines.

nova-consoleauth - The nova-consoleauth service manages token-based authentication.'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-03-02 21:09:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Anne: I don't see those additions in Patch 2. Can you confirm this is the correct patch?"}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-03-05 08:16:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (2 inline comments)

comment about openrc & cert (we should note what it is used for since the proximity to credentials make it seem like you have to obtain one)'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-03-05 14:13:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Yeah guess you only need certs for logging into VMs a particular way.'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-03-05 14:25:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-03-05 14:25:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Well crum I didn't do an amend to the commmit so now there are two. https://review.openstack.org/4915"}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-03-05 15:12:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-03-05 15:13:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

abandoning https://review.openstack.org/4915, review this one pretty please.'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2012-03-05 16:35:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (6 inline comments)

Some inline comments on updating the environment variables.'}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-03-05 18:05:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Dean / Anne, the doc says that the openrc is generated by dashboard.

My point is if the openrc is actually creating a lot of cruft we should fix it in dashboard!  Otherwise this might be an old version of openrc from dash?'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2012-03-05 18:25:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

The file currently in dashboard is pretty clean, really only the old Glance vars need to be removed from it. After that it is only OS_AUTH_URL, OS_TENANT_ID, OS_USERNAME and OS_PASSWORD.   I'll file a bug/patch to clean it up."}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-03-05 18:28:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

let's get a patch in to remove the glance config to dash asap, then get anne to have a clean openrc."}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2012-03-05 18:44:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Anne, here is the openrc.sh that Horizon produces with the patch below: http://paste.openstack.org/show/6588/

Bug and review to remove the Glance config from Horizon's openrc: https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/947352,  https://review.openstack.org/4931"}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-03-05 21:37:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (2 inline comments)

Some comments inline.'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-03-06 15:17:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I think that an exact replica of what you get from Dashboard is what I was going for, if you're going to change it to Compute 2 rather than 1.1 I'll use that one as "final" - can we leave it as is for now and merge?'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-03-06 17:42:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-03-09 15:49:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-manuals-merge/160/ : FAILURE'}, {'account_id': 1955, 'date': '2012-03-09 17:08:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: (1 inline comment)

commit_message:
Fix changing locale if using WSGIScriptAlias

In Fedora we are rooting the dashboard at /dashboard rather than
plain /. This changes the locale switcher to not reference the
absolute path /i18n

Change-Id: I8bb852fc84bf9991d9dcb3bddfc359c8674a87f9

subject: Makes sure ajax-updated rows still get correct actions allowed.
messages:
[{'account_id': 2455, 'date': '2012-03-07 17:10:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

There is an annoying bug, not introduced from this fix, but might be fixed with it too.

Look at: http://db.tt/5y9HmSt9

When an instance goes in Error state, the row is constantly updated with ajax-loader. If you click on the checkbox for the row, the checkbox goes off in 1 sec, and it is hard to move the mouse on the "Terminate instances" button before it goes unchecked again :) Also, the logic for the checkboxes is not applied after reloading and the "Terminate instances" actually doesn't get enabled at all.

One ugly workaround could be to remove the checkbox for ajax-loaded rows... Or to do a more complex change to load actual cell values instead of exact row html.'}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2012-03-08 00:40:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

There is already a bug open for that issue, assigned to me for RC1: https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/948432'}, {'account_id': 357, 'date': '2012-03-08 22:23:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 2654, 'date': '2012-03-09 17:34:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

why is this not yet merged?'}, {'account_id': 543, 'date': '2012-03-09 22:29:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-09 22:34:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified

commit_message:
User crud no longer available in syspanel when Keystone is using something
other than the native auth backend.

Fixes bug: 948310

Change-Id: Ifebf0f5a60228c84d06f11e60f752f9ff474c929

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-03-09 16:53:50.000000000', 'message': 'Switch all plugin async calls to be sync

This was likely because there was no way to do synchronous plugin calls
in XenAPI so they all did an asynchronous call and then blocked waiting
for the task to complete.

Change-Id: Ib86fc721326de34fd71d68bbec42ecd65280aa8a
'}, {'created': '2012-03-09 17:06:37.000000000', 'message': 'Switch all xenapi async plugin calls to be sync

Originally all calls were required to be async because of integration
with twisted, but that has long since been changed and just using the
synchronous calls is easier and less code.

Change-Id: Ib86fc721326de34fd71d68bbec42ecd65280aa8a
'}]
commit_message:
Switch all xenapi async plugin calls to be sync

Originally all calls were required to be async because of integration
with twisted, but that has long since been changed and just using the
synchronous calls is easier and less code.

Change-Id: Ib86fc721326de34fd71d68bbec42ecd65280aa8a

commit_message:
Add human-friendly ID support.

Allows a user to interact with certain models (image, flavors, and
servers currently) using a human-friendly identifier which is a
slugified form of the model name.

Example:

    nova boot --image debian-6-squeeze --flavor 256mb-instance myinst

Change-Id: I43dbedac3493d010c1ec9ba8b8bb1007ff7ac499

commit_message:
Fix EC2 credentials crud after policy backend change

https://review.openstack.org/4659 implemented the common policy code
but made a change to the exception thrown by wsgi.Application.assert_admin()
and Ec2Controller._is_admin() needed updating.

Fixes bug 950557

Change-Id: I0e27aeeabd1be5a6012e34aa71efdfc2f2d5a726

subject: Simplify unnecessary XenAPI Async calls to be synchronous
messages:
[{'account_id': 475, 'date': '2012-03-09 01:37:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Nice cleanup.'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2012-03-09 12:47:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

I thought the use of the async call was due to this line in the waiting loop:
 greenthread.sleep(FLAGS.xenapi_task_poll_interval)
It should ensure the greenlet can be prempted by other greenlets that may need to do work.

However, given the xapi library is a pure python one I guess it might work anyway? Have you tested if that you still get the concurrency?"}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-03-09 15:04:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

While XenAPI is pure python, the SSL code isn't and will block. That's why call_xenapi() uses eventlet tpool to make the XenAPI calls run in a separate real thread. It will let other eventlet's schedule and won't monopolize the CPU just waiting."}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2012-03-09 15:54:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

OK, sorry, that makes sense now.'}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2012-03-09 16:09:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-09 16:19:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified

Build Successful

https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-unittests/1476/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-pep8/3202/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-09 16:19:46.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

It's silly to make an Async call and then immediately block waiting for
the result

Change-Id: I197d786679fd9e2a287fa39d374c5f7e12bf121c
"}]
commit_message:
Simplify unnecessary XenAPI Async calls to be synchronous

It's silly to make an Async call and then immediately block waiting for
the result

Change-Id: I197d786679fd9e2a287fa39d374c5f7e12bf121c

commit_message:
Glance skip prompting if stdin isn't a tty

Don't have glance issue prompts if stdin isn't a tty.  Fixes bug 884116.

In glance's user_confirm routine, check if stdin is a tty and if
not, just return the default value. If it is a tty, then continue
with the raw_input call to issue the prompt and get the response.
Latest patch includes recommended change to check for isatty attr before
using it.

Added myself to Authors.

Change-Id: I8134668b8382b44618c86972190f3d7d98f55e52

subject: Replaced use of webob.Request.str_param
messages:
[{'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-03-08 05:59:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Since a similar change was made to quantum, I'm hoping there are no complications in switching to the unicode 'params' property.  Also, should DeprecationWarning simply be ignored across all OpenStack projects?  Python 2.7 ignores DeprecationWarning, so that would seem like a sane choice."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-03-08 16:00:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I would vote "no" to simply ignoring DeprecationWarning across the board.  Maybe it makes sense to ship with DeprecationWarning shut off, but during development, we should be seeing it and taking note of it, because DeprecationWarning is an indication that some interface we're using is about to go away.

I'll also note that I submitted the @deprecated() decorator to nova to mark interfaces we use in nova that we're deprecating; it uses DeprecationWarning to accomplish that desirable task…'}, {'account_id': 177, 'date': '2012-03-08 21:13:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

You gotta add yourself to glances Authors'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-03-08 22:59:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-03-08 23:11:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-03-09 15:37:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Approved

Thanks Maru for paying attention to this.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-09 15:58:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified

commit_message:
Replaced use of webob.Request.str_param

 * Changed webob.Request.str_param => webob.Request.param to
   ensure compatibility with WebOb >= 1.2.
 * Fixes bug 949677

Change-Id: I59c5af17fdef0754862ef6a0fda99978036112d9

commit_message:
Update to latest openstack-common

Simply by running:

  $> cd openstack-common
  $> python update.py ../melange

We should do this more often.

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-03-09 11:15:06.000000000', 'message': 'fix restructuredtext formatting in docstrings

blueprint sphinx-doc-cleanup
bug 94516

- Correct parameter declarations, list formatting, cross-references, etc.
- We don't need "let" in generate_autodoc_index.sh since we aren't doing math.
- Change conf.py to not prefix class and function names with full namespace
  in generated output to save width on the screen.

Change-Id: I9adc8681951913fd291d03e7142146e9d46841df
'}]
commit_message:
fix restructuredtext formatting in docstrings

blueprint sphinx-doc-cleanup
bug 94516

- Correct parameter declarations, list formatting, cross-references, etc.
- We don't need "let" in generate_autodoc_index.sh since we aren't doing math.
- Change conf.py to not prefix class and function names with full namespace
  in generated output to save width on the screen.

Change-Id: I9adc8681951913fd291d03e7142146e9d46841df

subject: Add support for venv-based test run with tox.
messages:
[{'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-02-01 00:11:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-02-08 02:48:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2012-02-08 09:40:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

This looks great to me!'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-02-15 00:28:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-02-15 00:31:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

The default for 'where' in setup.cfg was problems with .[unit,func,prob]tests.  The latest patch removes 'where' from setup.cfg, adds test/unit to nose invocations in tox.ini, and updates the old test runners to reflect the defaults available in setup.cfg."}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2012-02-23 16:06:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

bump so this doesn't go away"}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2012-02-29 23:00:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2012-03-01 17:05:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I would review this, but I have no idea what quite a bit of it is. It all seems perfectly sane to me, assuming we don't end up with a trunk gated by PEP8."}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-03-02 01:34:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

gholt	: This change does introduce trunk gating by pep8 (as virtually every other openstack project already has), but it will also allow developers to consistently and easily execute the unit/pep8 checks identically to Jenkins.  If you're interested in checing it out, fetch this change, pip install tox, and execute tox in the root of the repo."}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2012-03-02 01:45:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Do not submit

changed my vote because I didn't realize this introduces pep8 gating. we don't want gating on pep8"}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2012-03-02 02:01:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I think it'd be good to update the docs to reflect using tox. I just fetched this branch, sudo pip install tox, ran tox and got:

[TOX] ERROR: invocation failed, logfile: /home/gholt/swift/.tox/log/0.log

[TOX] ERROR: /home/gholt/swift$ /usr/bin/python setup.py sdist --formats=zip --dist-dir .tox/dist >.tox/log/0.log

...

making hard links in swift-1.4.7...

hard linking .functests -> swift-1.4.7

error: Operation not permitted"}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2012-03-02 04:27:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

This does not add trunk gating on pep8, it only provides an environment in which we can run pep8 tests.  Whether we gate on that is a separate question.

Our practice with tox-based tests is to make a Jenkins job for each test environment and run only that one in that job.  Since swift doesn't gate on pep8, we won't create a gate-swift-pep8 job.  However, we will update the swift-pep8 job, which runs post-commit, to use the pep8 environment provided by tox."}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2012-03-02 04:42:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

James, thanks for the clarification

restored by +2'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2012-03-06 15:44:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: No score

agree with gholt that this needs some docs on how to run it'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2012-03-06 17:31:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

If this is blocking something else from progressing, I'd be fine approving it and just making a note (bug?) to get the docs updated. I'd love to start running tox locally, but apparently I'm doing something wrong."}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-03-06 21:07:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

The docs are here in the Basic Example section:

http://tox.readthedocs.org/en/latest/index.html

gholt: I've been using tox for a while and haven't encountered the problem you're seeing.  Given the error it may be that the filesystem you're on doesn't play nicely with tox?"}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2012-03-08 03:41:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Yeah, it was the file system in use (vm shared guest/host). I ran in on a purely in-vm file system and it was fine.

For docs, we mean the SAIO docs shown at http://swift.openstack.org/development_saio.html and built from <swift>/doc/source/development_saio.rst

If a build fails, it'd be good for devs used to using SAIO instructions to be able to repeat what the build box is doing so they can fix it."}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2012-03-08 03:49:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I just noticed the Python 2.7 stuff. I probably missed a "memo", but are we trying to support Python 2.7 now? I've only ever been working with Ubuntu 10.04 and Python 2.6. If that has changed, the docs at http://swift.openstack.org/getting_started.html indicating the System Requirements should also be updated, or we should drop the Python 2.7 option. If we keep the 2.7 option, whose volunteering to keep up with that?'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-03-08 04:51:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-03-08 05:06:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

gholt: I added instructions to development_guidelines instead of development_saio, as per John Dickinson's instruction.  Is this acceptable, or should the saio instructions be updates as well (if only with a pointer to the guidelines)?

As to the question of the Python 2.7 build, it is included as per mtaylor to align with the testing efforts of other Openstack projects.  Similarly to pep8,   whether a 2.7 build is configured in Jenkins will be up to the Swift and CI teams to decide.

What should the default tox invocation build?  Most openstack projects are defaulting to py26,py27,pep8, but are gating on all of them.  Since Swift intends to gate only on py26, should that be the only build that runs by default, or can pep8 be included as well to encourage pep8 compliant changes?  Again, this would only affect local tox invocations (tox without -e), and would not affect what trunk is gated on."}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2012-03-08 05:18:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2012-03-08 06:09:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I think all references to ./.unittests ./.functests and ./probetests would have to be updated since you can't just run them anymore.

Also, the removal --exe means some tests are now skipped."}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2012-03-08 06:13:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Nevermind on the --exe, missing the conf exe setting. :)

Not sure how to run functests and probetests though. And how do I get coverage output?'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-03-08 06:20:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

gholt: .[unit,func/probe]tests all run as before, but they target the existing environment rather than a tox virtualenv.  The existence of .unittests may seem duplicative, but it allows running the unittests in a constent fashion against a non-isolated environment (say, an SAIO).   .functests and .probetests are not good candidates for tox isolation, since they require a running version of swift.'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-03-08 06:25:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

gholt: Coverage support in .unittests is unchanged.   Executing a tox run for coverage would be 'tox -e coverage'.

Given that .unittests runs coverage by default, should the default tox builds be 'coverage,pep8' instead of 'py26,pep8' to replicate the behaviour of .unittests?"}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2012-03-08 06:31:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Ah, seems you need to add:

sudo pip install openstack.nose_plugin

to the appropriate docs, since that's required now.

and I figured out tox -e cover while perusing the diff.

I assume one would not run tox to do functional tests?

If so, most devs will probably stick with the ./.blah stuff, so I suppose the defaults for tox wouldn't matter too much (to devs).

For me, it sounds like my work has has changed to:

sudo pip install tox openstack.nose_plugin
Write code as before.
./.unittests as before.
./.functests as before.
./.probetests as before.
tox -e pep8

I think I got everything."}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-03-08 06:45:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-03-08 06:46:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

The latest patch adds instructions for installing the openstack.nose_plugin to the saio doc.'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2012-03-08 06:50:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

That should do it. I guess we'll find out soon enough as devs start running into it. Thanks."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-08 06:50:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Fails

Build Failed 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-swift-unittests/119436/ : FAILURE 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-swift-merge/109/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2012-03-08 08:04:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: No score

Well, it's 2am here, so I'll next check this in 7-8 hours and see if you guys want to retry this then."}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-03-08 08:16:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

mtaylor: I think you're going to have to manually land this change.  The setup.cfg change makes the unit tests dependent on openstack.nose_plugin, which won't be available until this patch lands and the Jenkins job is updated to use tox."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-09 03:11:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Verified

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-swift-merge/114/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2012-03-09 03:11:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Approved

Re-kicking.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-09 03:13:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-swift-python27/1/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-swift-merge/115/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-09 03:13:20.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

[{'created': '2012-02-01 00:00:18.000000000', 'message': "Add support for venv-based test run with tox.

The initial version of this change ported the venv code (run_tests.sh,
runner.py, etc) from Nova.  On mtaylor's advice, tox was used instead of
run_test.sh, but runner.py was retained to ensure parity between nova and
swift's test output.  Is this desirable, or should nosetests be used
directly?  Separately, should .unittests be removed, retained as-is, or
updated to use tox?  I imagine it being useful to execute the tests
against the configured system rather than a venv.

 * Adds tox config
   - based on the config from python-quantumclient and updated for
     test, pep8 and coverage execution as per nova's run_tests.sh.
 * Adds dependencies in tools/pip-requires
   - dependencies were gathered by referencing the packages used in
     creation of a Swift All In One.  Versions were determined by
     checking the swift-core/trunk ppa or, failing that, the version
     available in lucid.
   - test-related dependencies (nose, covereage, etc) were updated to
     the latest version available rather than sticking to the packaged
     version.
 * Adds Nova test runner to tools/runner.py
 * Updates swift/common/middleware/formpost.py for pep8 compliance
 * Fixes bug 909177

Change-Id: I5407924d2181e9ab335aaf76bf30c8d40deccbb4

commit_message:
Add support for venv-based test run with tox.

 * Adds tox config
   - based on the config from python-quantumclient and updated for
     test, pep8 and coverage execution as per nova's run_tests.sh.
 * Adds nosetests defaults in setup.cfg
 * Adds runtime dependencies in tools/pip-requires
   - dependencies were gathered by referencing the packages used in
     creation of a Swift All In One.  Versions were determined by
     checking the swift-core/trunk ppa or, failing that, the version
     available in lucid.
 * Adds test dependencies in tools/test-requires
 * Updates swift/common/middleware/formpost.py for pep8 compliance
 * Adds instructions for executing the tests with Tox to the
   developer_guidelines
 * Adds instructions for installing openstack.nose_plugin to
   developer_saio
 * Fixes bug 909177

Change-Id: I5407924d2181e9ab335aaf76bf30c8d40deccbb4

commit_message:
Update tox.ini for jenkins.

The tox documentation is wrong, it looks for [tox:jenkins] instead
of [tox:hudson].  Also, run "pip freeze" before running tests from
within the virtualenv so we have a record of all versions used
in each test run in Jenkins.

Change-Id: Id0f34247f4545268f21dacb860d2e0fe72677a11

commit_message:
boto shouldn't be required for production deploys

... if you're not using ec2/s3.

Fixes bug 949631

bin/nova-manage imports auth.manager which imports auth.signer which
tries to import boto...  but nova-manage doesn't try to authenticate.

This patch allows bin/nova-manage to work if you don't have boto
installed.

Change-Id: I9b7929a15b991498ab0491821521ec20ed0da65c

subject: port common policy code to keystone
messages:
[{'account_id': 494, 'date': '2012-02-29 02:04:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-02-29 04:22:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

lgtm. I presume you'll bring in some unit tests when you hook up the new policy stuff in and replace the existing assert calls in the controllers?"}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-02-29 17:37:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(5 inline comments)

comments inline - would really like to see a unit test or two that drives the policy logic (simple role, rule, dictionary, and recursive aspects)"}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2012-02-29 18:55:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (3 inline comments)

some responses, I can add the logging stuff to common.policy and try to get that merged back into nova and glance too, and yeah I'll think up and write some tests"}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2012-03-01 19:12:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-03-02 19:55:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (4 inline comments)

Looks good to me.  Comments are suggestions except for keystone/common/policy:146 - is this print statement intentional?'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2012-03-03 02:16:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Something is very wrong when I run the unit tests.  A large swatch of them fail,  starting with:
JsonTestCase.  The error message for the first failure is:
 File "/home/ayoung/devel/openstack/keystone/keystone/policy/backends/brain.py", line 23, in <module>
    from keystone.common import cfg
ImportError: cannot import name cfg
-------------------- >> begin captured logging << --------------------
root: DEBUG: Inner Exception: cannot import name cfg

This is when applied to the top of tree, and are probably may be due to changes that have happened since this patch was applied.  there is no file with keystone.common.cfg in it in keystone/common anymore.'}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2012-03-05 20:41:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2012-03-05 20:48:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2012-03-05 20:49:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (4 inline comments)

fixed your stuff, trying not to modify policy.py as it is copied from nova and we want to make it an openstack.common thing'}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2012-03-05 20:50:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-03-05 20:57:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2012-03-06 15:06:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(5 inline comments)

The term Brain is wro0ng:  too cutesy and does not explain what the class does.  Also,  there appears to be a lot of code in there for an extendible framework,  but until we have more than one implementation,  it is "too much design, too soon."'}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2012-03-06 18:42:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: (5 inline comments)

ayoung: thanks for the review, I'll look into changing the name, but I think you missed the point on a couple things:

1. much of the code you were reviewing is common code (I tried to make a note of that so that people wouldn't keep reviewing common.policy),

2. the patterns you describe in much of your review points are established patterns throughout the rest of the codebase, not something made up for this patch

towards too much extensibility too soon, the class has already been expanded twice, which is why the extensibility was added in the original designs (the code from nova), and there is already a pretty likely next extension for the "domain" work that is being proposed (a "domain_role" matcher), so i think we're at the right spot for that

do things make more sense now?'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2012-03-07 18:44:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

termie,  yes,  makes a lot of sense.  Suspected that there was more to this than I saw.


Enough people have beat on the "Brain" issue.  It is going to be hard to come up with the right name,  and if it is already used elsewhere, then we are,  for the time being, stuck with it.'}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2012-03-07 20:41:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2012-03-07 20:42:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

removed extra file and renamed the driver per ayoung's suggestions, this should pass once https://review.openstack.org/#change,5037 lands"}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-03-07 22:15:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2012-03-07 23:49:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

other patch landed, approving this to try to merge now'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-07 23:55:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Fails

Build Failed

port common policy code to keystone

keystone.common.policy is copied from nova

leave simple backend in as a shim until devstack stops referencing it

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-03-08 19:02:59.000000000', 'message': 'Increase logging for xenapi plugin glance uploads

Without this change, the glance plugin is pretty quiet about image
uploads. But it can definitely be helpful to debugging to have
information such as which glance server is handling the upload, how much
data was sent, and more information about the glance server response if
it was something other than 200 OK.

Change-Id: I0269478ad1061fc2021ef4b5d9c3c1dea9b2f6cb
'}]
commit_message:
Increase logging for xenapi plugin glance uploads

Without this change, the glance plugin is pretty quiet about image
uploads. But it can definitely be helpful to debugging to have
information such as which glance server is handling the upload, how much
data was sent, and more information about the glance server response if
it was something other than 200 OK.

Change-Id: I0269478ad1061fc2021ef4b5d9c3c1dea9b2f6cb

using FlatDHCP.

Fixes LP Bug #950029.

subject: Adds name_check filter
messages:
[{'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2012-03-05 15:11:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Can you make your three reviews into one? For instance, this setup.py change isn't useful without the filter it references, and the character list update could just be part of the original review."}, {'account_id': 1005, 'date': '2012-03-05 16:55:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1005, 'date': '2012-03-06 16:50:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1005, 'date': '2012-03-06 16:54:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2012-03-06 17:43:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Looking good, just a couple minor things now:

Copyright should be 2012

$ pep8 -r swift/common/middleware/name_check.py
swift/common/middleware/name_check.py:53:80: E501 line too long (80 characters)
swift/common/middleware/name_check.py:64:80: E501 line too long (87 characters)
swift/common/middleware/name_check.py:90:80: E501 line too long (82 characters)
swift/common/middleware/name_check.py:94:80: E501 line too long (84 characters)'}, {'account_id': 1005, 'date': '2012-03-07 08:52:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 1005, 'date': '2012-03-07 10:43:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 1005, 'date': '2012-03-07 14:29:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2012-03-07 21:33:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Can you please also add in a "name_check" filter section to the example proxy config that shows the default values? This will help documenting the available options.

Don't add this middleware to the example pipeline, but add the filter section with the available variables commented out showing their defaults. For example, see the "domain_remap" filter section in the example config file.'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2012-03-08 03:26:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

I think this diff would do what notmyname desires (plus it updates the doc to match the default forbidden chars):

diff --git a/etc/proxy-server.conf-sample b/etc/proxy-server.conf-sample

index e6afb91..2cc8745 100644

--- a/etc/proxy-server.conf-sample

+++ b/etc/proxy-server.conf-sample

@@ -220,3 +220,9 @@ use = egg:swift#tempurl

 # Note: Put formpost just before your auth filter(s) in the pipeline

 [filter:formpost]

 use = egg:swift#formpost

+

+# Note: Just needs to be placed before the proxy-server in the pipeline.

+[filter:name_check]

+use = egg:swift#name_check

+forbidden_chars = '"`<>

+maximum_length = 255

diff --git a/swift/common/middleware/name_check.py b/swift/common/middleware/name_check.py

index fa5e729..380f867 100644

--- a/swift/common/middleware/name_check.py

+++ b/swift/common/middleware/name_check.py

@@ -25,7 +25,7 @@ pipeline = catch_errors healthcheck name_check cache tempauth sos proxy-server

 

 [filter:name_check]

 use = egg:swift#name_check

-forbidden_chars = '"`

+forbidden_chars = '"`<>

 maximum_length = 255

 

 There are default settings for forbidden_chars (FORBIDDEN_CHARS) and'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2012-03-08 03:27:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Man, gerrit makes a mess of pastes; here's a link to hopefully clearer version:

https://raw.github.com/gist/1998401/0b48cacfe9009751da6d45739df2bff06e4b3494/gistfile1.txt"}, {'account_id': 1005, 'date': '2012-03-08 09:04:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2012-03-08 14:32:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2012-03-08 16:32:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

final 2 comments:

1) The tests don't pass pep8. This isn't a big deal, but if you make any more changes, it would be nice to fix this as well. 

2) Should the return code be 400 rather than 403? It seems that a 400 is a better response (because it's a bad syntax). What are your thoughts?"}, {'account_id': 1005, 'date': '2012-03-08 16:43:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

We discussed the issue of the error code at length.  The consensus seemed to be that 

403:"The request was a legal request, but the server is refusing to respond to it"

was the best response but that none of the standard responses were perfect.  Personally I'm not too pushed; I'd originally plumped for 400 myself.  It is more important, I think, that the http response body is meaningful and that it gets printed.  I've submitted some changes to swift.common.client to print the body if it exists when there is an error.  Currently under review: bug 949843.

I'll change the response to 400 if you want, just let me know.  I'll also fix-up the pep8 errors in the tests and resubmit.'}, {'account_id': 1005, 'date': '2012-03-08 16:50:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2012-03-08 17:11:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

In our proxy code we use 400 Bad Request for our name length limits (256 for account and container names, 1024 for object names). 403 as I understand it, usually means you don't have the authorization for the request but presumably, someone does. ;)

That said, I'm not overly concerned with it."}, {'account_id': 1005, 'date': '2012-03-08 17:21:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 1005, 'date': '2012-03-08 17:23:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

Changed error code to 400.'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2012-03-08 17:43:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2012-03-08 18:17:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

commit_message:
Adds name_check filter

Bug 926048.

Filter checks path for user-defined forbidden characters, and for
user-defined maximum length.

Includes changes to reflect gholt's latest comments to Patch Set 4
Also includes a change to a unit-test, renames another unit-test,
and removes one superfluous unit-test.

Added section to the example proxy config

Fixed-up unit test pep8 warnings

Changed error response code to 400 (Bad Request)

Change-Id: Iace719d6a3d00fb3dda1b9d0bc185b8c4cbc00ca

Add kwargs to RequestContext __init__

Fixes bug 949726

This allows processing of rpc messages that contain older versions of
RequestContext to not raise an exception.

Require a more recent version of glance

Recent changes started using a recently added exception to
glance.common.exception, so update pip-requires to require a version
of glance that has that.

subject: info_cache is related to deleted instance
messages:
[{'account_id': 191, 'date': '2012-03-08 06:18:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

what is now possible:
http://pastie.org/3546474

the problem was there were entities hitting the api to get network data for instances that were deleted. Deleted instances did not have the backref to info_cache available. The api would then go to network to get the info, but since the network structures had already been torn down, there was nothing to return. The bug then is that network_info at time of instance deletion was expected to be accessible through the instance['info_cache']."}, {'account_id': 191, 'date': '2012-03-08 06:19:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2012-03-08 14:53:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
info_cache is related to deleted instance

fixes lp948586

what is now possible:
http://pastie.org/3546474

the problem was there were entities hitting the api to get network data
for instances that were deleted. Deleted instances did not have the
backref to info_cache available. The api would then go to network to get
the info, but since the network structures had already been torn down,
there was nothing to return. The bug then is that network_info at time
of instance deletion was expected to be accessible through the
instance['info_cache'].

Change-Id: I8ce6ce92e2abe6241d408192ced9526562e978db

subject: Set lock_path to a tempdir in TestLockCleanup
messages:
[{'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-03-06 17:53:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Why is a UUID necessary here, though?  Seems like a simple random integer would be sufficient…'}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-03-06 19:42:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Or perhaps use a unique directory (nova.utils.tempdir) instead of unique file?'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-03-06 23:31:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I like that idea better…'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-03-07 11:40:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Yeah, something like:

    def setUp(self):
        ...
        self.lock_dir = tempfile.mkdtemp(...)
        self.flags(lock_path=self.lock_dir)
        ...
        self.lock_name = 'nova-testlock'
        self.lock_file = os.path.join(FLAGS.lock_path,	
                                      self.lock_name + '.lock')
        ...

    def tearDown(self):
        shutil.rmtree(self.lock_dir)

Fix racey snapshots.

Fixes bug 949475

Atomically tests and sets the instance task_state before allowing a
snapshot or backup to be initiated.

subject: Replaces pipelines with flag for auth strategy
messages:
[{'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-03-06 06:57:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(2 inline comments)

Very nice, just need to remove some debug statements"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-03-06 07:00:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

We should move glance to this method too. Currently it has a slightly more awkward method ... in the conf file:

  [paste_deploy]
  flavor = keystone+caching

and in paste.ini:

   [pipeline:glance-api-keystone+caching]
   pipeline = ...'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-03-06 07:10:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-03-06 07:16:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

fixed.

Note that this will mess up the ratelimit workaround in devstack for tempest. I think we should probably create a flag to disable ratelimiting or set it to infinite.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-03-06 07:24:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

made this bug about ratelimiting:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/947776'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-03-06 07:35:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-03-06 08:57:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hi Vish,

This approach seems to intertwine the choice of auth strategy with the paste pipeline selection, whereas in the glance case pipelines may often be selected with non-auth concerns in mind. For example the inclusion of caching and cache mgmt filters. So I'm thinking we'd need to drive this off something more general than auth_strategy in order to adopt a similar approach for glance.

One other thing to note, nova rate limiting being inadvertently enabled is not as big an issue as before for Tempest, as I've added logic to transparently redrive throttled testcases:

  https://github.com/openstack/tempest/commit/a559897a

Cheers,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-03-06 16:18:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

(1 inline comment)

Looks good…'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-03-06 16:18:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-06 16:44:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Fails

This needs https://review.openstack.org/#change,4956 to merge first.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-03-06 17:48:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Yes it may not be easy to do exactly the same for glance.  In general I think conf files should expose simple options, not pipelines.  An advanced user can go in and mess with the pipeline, but it should be easy to select the appropriate settings via simple configuration options.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-03-06 20:36:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-03-06 20:36:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

commit_message:
Replaces pipelines with flag for auth strategy

 Forcing deployers to modify a paste config file to change auth
 strategies is very fragile. This simplifies things by keying
 pipeline construction off of a single flag. Note that this will
 require a small change to devstack.

Change-Id: I49728c356266e6084ecafb6c59542390137f89e9

commit_message:
Don't swallow snapshot exceptions.

Fixes bug 949471

This raise is needed so that calling code can be notified to teardown
the failed snapshot.

Change-Id: I25a78e36b4bdb4ca52f1f999168a750dde134056

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-03-08 04:17:47.000000000', 'message': "pyflakes cleanups on libvirt/connection.py

This happens to fix another issue I ran into where boto was being
required when trying to start up the compute manager.  This is because
virt/connection.py would import virt/libvirt/connection.py which would
import nova.auth.manager which would import nova.auth.signer which would
try to import boto.

Fortunately, we don't need to import nova.auth.manager in
libvirt/connection.py as it's no longer required.

Change-Id: I85f8e874ef3dc6f53667918ae081512115608d83
"}]
commit_message:
pyflakes cleanups on libvirt/connection.py

This happens to fix another issue I ran into where boto was being
required when trying to start up the compute manager.  This is because
virt/connection.py would import virt/libvirt/connection.py which would
import nova.auth.manager which would import nova.auth.signer which would
try to import boto.

Fortunately, we don't need to import nova.auth.manager in
libvirt/connection.py as it's no longer required.

Change-Id: I85f8e874ef3dc6f53667918ae081512115608d83

[{'created': '2012-03-07 23:07:36.000000000', 'message': "Remove cruft and broken code from nova-manage

 * Deletes live migration code. This code will not work in keystone
   installs, and there is an api extension that can be used through
   the python-novaclient cli
 * Deletes image management code. This was for upgrading pre-diablo
   images and doesn't work properly with glance/keystone. The glance
   cli already has the necessary functionality for uploading images.

Change-Id: Id7257833a280663af6d0b90085d03344d75a502f
"}]
commit_message:
Remove cruft and broken code from nova-manage

 * Deletes live migration code. This code will not work in keystone
   installs, and there is an api extension that can be used through
   the python-novaclient cli
 * Deletes image management code. This was for upgrading pre-diablo
   images and doesn't work properly with glance/keystone. The glance
   cli already has the necessary functionality for uploading images.

Change-Id: Id7257833a280663af6d0b90085d03344d75a502f

subject: Improve auth_str_equal().
messages:
[{'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-03-06 18:29:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

heh. security programming is hard. You must do things arse about face. looks good.'}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-03-06 18:42:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-03-06 19:11:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hmm, this change still doesn't protect against finding the length of the password I think. It does make it a little harder I suppose, but..

The zip will be of length of the shortest of s1 & s2.
Hence with only slightly more accurate timing, that will allow
the attacker to get the password length.

Now knowing the password length isn't much of an issue.
The main thing protected currently is the early break per character. Not doing that allows one to attack one char
at a time, greatly reducing the combinations one needs to try"}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-03-06 20:20:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-03-06 20:21:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Thanks for the feedback, pbrady.  I made another pass at this to make it even harder to get the length of the password.'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-03-06 21:56:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I suppose for full blown tin foil hattedness you don't want the last line to short circuit either.

I.E.change: return p_len == k_len and result == 0
to:  return (p_len == k_len) & (result == 0)
Note the parenthesis"}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-03-06 22:00:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-03-06 22:00:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Ha, fair point pbrady ... updated.  <:-)  (that's me with my tin foil hat on)"}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-03-06 22:18:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

+1 for the tin foil hat'}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-03-06 22:53:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Fine by me.'}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-03-08 03:49:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-03-08 03:54:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified

[{'created': '2012-03-06 18:24:52.000000000', 'message': 'Improve auth_str_equal().

This patch is to improve auth_str_equal() a bit.  The whole point of
this function is to do a string comparison in constant time to help

commit_message:
Improve auth_str_equal().

This patch is to improve auth_str_equal() a bit.  The whole point of
this function is to do a string comparison in constant time to help
protect against timing attacks.  The original implementation had a bit
of a silly property in that it would exit early if the strings were not
of the same length.  This would theoretically still allow someone to
discover the proper length of a password.

This patch moves the length verification to the end.  It also makes it
so the main loop time to run is a function of the provided password
length instead of the length of the shorter of the two strings.

Change-Id: I6dbe076818b7e3e8a313544ebd5c5734b5a025e5

commit_message:
fixes bug lp#948439 belongs_to and serviceCatalog behavior
* removing belongs_to as a kwarg and getting from the context
* adding a serviceCatalog for belongs_to calls to tokens
* adding test to validate belongs_to behavior in tokens

Change-Id: If6f6a7007a6830c57a5ac71aef0090e57a064232

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-03-07 19:58:58.000000000', 'message': "prevent keyerrors when accessing optional keys

You used to have these in the token, why were they removed and then
subsequently grabbed at? The change that added these doesn't work against
keystone, btw, so I'm surprised it got in, these dict keys are not
required to be in the return from service_catalog.get_token() and
adding them as properties is only going to make matters worse as people
rarely think about having None attributes.

Change-Id: I695bbd6730d25d8db3a25cea81e3ffb0ef289bbb
"}]
commit_message:
prevent keyerrors when accessing optional keys

You used to have these in the token, why were they removed and then
subsequently grabbed at? The change that added these doesn't work against
keystone, btw, so I'm surprised it got in, these dict keys are not
required to be in the return from service_catalog.get_token() and
adding them as properties is only going to make matters worse as people
rarely think about having None attributes.

Change-Id: I695bbd6730d25d8db3a25cea81e3ffb0ef289bbb

commit_message:
Remove the <acpi/> feature from UML/LXC guests

The <acpi/> feature is only relevant to Xen paravirt or Xen/KVM/QEMU
fullvirt guests. Remove it from UML/LXC guests

Change-Id: I782b99455549ae49bf8adc8f40f5ea73b57f790e

commit_message:
setup.py: Fix doc building

Commit 5702f80a0 updated local_BuildDoc's parameters without
also updating references to the original parameters.  This fixes
the issue and gets './setup.py build_sphinx' working again.

Change-Id: I3483c906c13347a718e1794786830f06af700ebd
